Picture the sun exploding - there would be a gigantic noise and then...nothing. Everything would plunge into darkness. 	 	On-Yomi: アン   Kun-Yomi: くら.い、くら.む、くれ.る  	Examples: 暗い (くら.い)"
rhyme	"rhyme 	 	韻   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 520   Strokes: 19   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: rhyme, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, employee, mouth, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Poetry restricted to verses that rhyme often finds it has to abandon clarity of thought in order to make the rhyme of the words work. In this kanji's picture, one becomes a kind of ""sound-employee."" 	 	 	What is a RHYME but some SOUND that EMPLOYEES say to get them through work. 	 	On-Yomi: イン   Kun-Yomi:"
discriminating	"discriminating 	 	識   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 521   Strokes: 19   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: discriminating, say, words, keitai, mouth, kazoo, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, fiesta 	 	A person of discriminating intellect can tell the difference between mere kazoo-buzzing and words spoken wisely. 	 	 	Words are difficult to discriminate/discern from sounds in the middle of a fiesta. 	 	On-Yomi: シキ   Kun-Yomi: し.る、しる.す"
mirror	"mirror 	 	鏡   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 522   Strokes: 19   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: mirror, metal, gold, mirror, vase, stand up, sun, day, human legs 	 	After lakes but before glass, polished metal was used for mirrors. These metal mirrors are recalled in this character for a mirror. 	 	 	Mirror should suggest vanity. Imagine a spoiled girl who gets her parents to buy her a Golden mirror so she can stand in front of it all day vainly admiring her lovely human legs. 	 	On-Yomi: キョウ、ケイ   Kun-Yomi: かがみ  	Examples: 鏡 (かがみ)"
boundary	"boundary 	 	境   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 523   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: boundary, soil, dirt, ground, mirror, vase, stand up, sun, day, human legs 	 	Imagine the boundary of a plot of land marked with gigantic mirrors enabling the landowner to keep trespassers in sight at all times. 	 	 	In the dense cities of Japan even a small garden is a luxury. In this house, the owner has put mirrors on the boundary of his land so it feels much bigger. 	 	On-Yomi: キョウ、ケイ   Kun-Yomi: さかい  	Examples: 境界 (きょうかい), 境地 (きょうち), 逆境 (ぎゃっきょう), 境 (さかい)"
deceased	"deceased 	 	亡   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 524   Strokes: 3   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook 	 	A top hat hanging on a hook in the front hall, right where the deceased left it the day he died, reminds us of him and his kanji. 	  * In addition to deceased, the primitive meaning of to perish will also be used for this character. 	 	The top hat hanging on a hook belonged to the now deceased Charlie Chaplin. 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ、モウ   Kun-Yomi: な.い、な.き-、ほろ.びる、ほろ.ぶ、ほろ.ぼす  	Examples: 亡父 (ぼうふ), 亡命 (ぼうめい), 存亡 (そんぼう), 亡い (な.い)"
blind	"blind 	 	盲   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 525   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: blind, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, eye 	 	If one's eyes perish before death, one remains blind for the rest of life. 	 	 	Deceased eyes! Easy ;). 	 	On-Yomi: モウ   Kun-Yomi: めくら"
delusion	"delusion 	 	妄   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 526   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: delusion, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, woman 	 	The ""ideal woman"" one daydreams about is no more than a delusion. Hence, perish the thought of her. 	 	 	I had a problem with remembering that ""deceased"" went over the ""woman"". So, here´s my story: The delusional woman was carrying her deceased husband on her back. 	 	On-Yomi: モウ、ボウ   Kun-Yomi: みだ.りに  	Examples: 妄信 (もうしん), 妄想 (もうそう), 迷妄 (めいもう)"
laid waste	"laid waste 	 	荒   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 527   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: laid waste, wreath, flowers, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, stream, flood 	 	The flowers that perish in the flood are taken here as symbols of an area that has been laid waste. 	 	 	After Godzilla laid waste to the city, the survivors put some flowers on the bodies of the deceased and floated their bodies down the stream. 	 	On-Yomi: コウ   Kun-Yomi: あら.い、あら-、あ.れる、あ.らす、-あ.らし、すさ.む  	Examples: 荒らす (あ.らす), 荒れる (あ.れる), 荒い (あら.い)"
ambition	"ambition 	 	望   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 528   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: ambition, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, king, jewel, ball 	 	The story of ambition talks of a king walking under the perishing (or ""waning"") moon dreaming great dreams about his kingdom. (The roots of ambition are from the same word as ""ambulate,"" meaning to walk about.) 	 	 	You´re dead meat, buddy, my ambition is to be king. 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ、モウ   Kun-Yomi: のぞ.む、もち  	Examples: 望郷 (ぼうきょう), 希望 (きぼう), 人望 (じんぼう), 望む (のぞ.む)"
direction	"direction 	 	方   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 529   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: direction, compass, direction 	 	Spinning a dagger about on its hilt on the top of a top hat - waiting to see in which direction it points when it comes to rest - one leaves to fate where one is going next. Take care in writing this character. 	  * As a primitive, this character will take the sense of a compass, the instrument used to determine direction. 	 	Note: The primitives are top hat and bound up. Compare ten thousand (#64). Story: A rich man wearing a top hat and bound up from head to toe hobbles up to you and asks for directions to the nearest police station because he just escaped from his kidnappers. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: かた、-かた、-がた  	Examples: 方 (かた)"
disturb	"disturb 	 	妨   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 530   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: disturb, compass, direction, woman 	 	Imagine a compass that is disturbed every time a woman passes by, sending the needle spinning madly round and round. 	 	 	Capt. Jack Sparrow´s compass gets disturbed every time a beautiful woman walks by him (just picture Keira Knightley in her sexy asian outfit as Elizabeth and the image will be fixed forever). 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ   Kun-Yomi: さまた.げる  	Examples: 妨げる (さまた.げる)"
boy	"boy 	 	坊   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 531   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT:    	Constituents: boy, soil, dirt, ground, compass, direction 	 	The character for a boy shows us a Boy Scout cleaning the dirt out of his compass - the more dirt, the better. 	 	 	Little boys always head in the direction of mud and dirt. 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ、ボッ   Kun-Yomi:   	Examples: 坊主 (ぼうず), 朝寝坊 (あさねぼう), 赤ん坊 (あかんぼう)"
perfumed	"perfumed 	 	芳   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 532   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: perfume, flowers, compass, direction 	 	Here we see a special compass used to pick out those flowers most suited for making good perfumes. 	 	 	She used a perfume so strong, that you can track her by following the direction of the smell of flowers. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: かんば.しい  	Examples: 芳しい (かんば.しい)"
obese	"obese 	 	肪   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 533   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: obese, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, compass, direction 	 	If you eat too much, you may need a compass to find your way around the obese mass of flesh that piles up in the midsection. Compare this with your stories for round (Frame 44) and fat (Frame 494), similar in meaning but distinct in imagery. 	 	 	Flesh in all directions = obese. 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ   Kun-Yomi:"
call on	"call on 	 	訪   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 534   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: call on, say, words, keitai, mouth, compass, direction 	 	When making a courtesy call on a dignitary, one has to gauge one's words with great care. Hence the need for a compass. 	 	 	When you call on someone, you point your words in their direction. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: おとず.れる、たず.ねる、と.う  	Examples: 訪れる (おとず.れる), 訪ねる (たず.ねる)"
set free	"set free 	 	放   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 535   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: set free, compass, direction, taskmaster 	 	The taskmaster sets an unruly servant free, giving him no more than a quick glance at the compass and a boot from behind. 	 	 	Go in any direction away from your taskmaster when you are set free. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: はな.す、-っぱな.し、はな.つ、はな.れる、こ.く、ほう.る  	Examples: 放す (はな.す), 放つ (はな.つ), 放れる (はな.れる)"
violent	"violent 	 	激   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 536   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: violent, water, water droplets, water pistol, white, dove, compass, direction, taskmaster 	 	Some cosmic taskmaster hovering overhead whips up the waves to make them dash violently against the shore. In the white foam that covers the water we see a broken compass floating, all that remains of a shipwreck. 	 	 	When the taskmaster found his favorite white compas damaged by water, he became the most violent taskmaster there ever was. 	 	On-Yomi: ゲキ   Kun-Yomi: はげ.しい  	Examples: 激しい (はげ.しい)"
undress	"undress 	 	脱   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 537   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: undress, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs 	 	To undress is to expose the flesh and tempt the devil in the eyes of one's onlookers. Ignore the moral if you want, but not the devil. 	 	 	HORNY TEENAGERS love to UNDRESS FLESH. 	 	On-Yomi: ダツ   Kun-Yomi: ぬ.ぐ、ぬ.げる  	Examples: 脱ぐ (ぬ.ぐ), 脱げる (ぬ.げる)"
explanation	"explanation 	 	説   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 538   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: rumor, say, words, keitai, mouth, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs 	 	Not inappropriately, this character likens an explanation to the devil's own words. 	 	 	The words of a horny teenager typically fall into one of two categories: either rumors or explanations. 	 	On-Yomi: セツ、ゼイ   Kun-Yomi: と.く  	Examples: 説明 (せつめい), 小説 (しょうせつ), 演説 (えんぜつ), 説く (と.く)"
pointed	"pointed 	 	鋭   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 539   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: pointed, metal, gold, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs 	 	Metal that has been pointed (as an awl, a pick, a nail, or a knife) tends to serve the devil's purposes as well as civilization's: our tools are also our weapons. 	 	 	Pointed is the metal devil´s pitchfork. 	 	On-Yomi: エイ   Kun-Yomi: するど.い  	Examples: 鋭い (するど.い)"
formerly	"formerly 	 	曽   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 540   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT:    	Constituents: formerly, increase, horns, rice field, brains, sun, day 	 	This primitive (named for its associations with the kanji of the following frame) is composed of a pair of horns growing out of a brain with a tongue wagging in the mouth beneath. Think of ""former"" in connection with administrators or heads of state who have just left office but continue to make a nuisance of themselves by advertising their opinions on public policy. 	  * The primitive meaning, increase, comes from the next frame. Always think of something multiplying wildly as you watch. 	 	The Artist formerly Known as Prince has the horniest brain around, and I think you can imagine what his wagging tongue is doing... 	 	On-Yomi: ソウ、ソ、ゾウ   Kun-Yomi: かつ、かつて、すなわち"
increase	"increase 	 	増   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 541   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: increase, soil, dirt, ground, increase, formerly, horns, rice field, brains, sun, day 	 	This kanji depicts an increase of soil, multiplying so fast that it literally buries everything in its path. 	 	 	Prices always INCREASE for LAND that was FORMERLY cheaper. 	 	On-Yomi: ゾウ   Kun-Yomi: ま.す、ま.し、ふ.える、ふ.やす  	Examples: 増える (ふ.える), 増やす (ふ.やす), 増す (ま.す)"
presents	"presents 	 	贈   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 542   Strokes: 18   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: presents, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, increase, formerly, horns, rice field, brains, sun, day 	 	The presents offered here are money that increases each time you give it away. Do not confuse with the temporal word ""present"" (Frame 275). 	 	 	Presents represent money that was formerly yours. 	 	On-Yomi: ゾウ、ソウ   Kun-Yomi: おく.る  	Examples: 贈与 (ぞうよ), 贈呈 (ぞうてい), 贈答 (ぞうとう), 贈る (おく.る)"
east	"east 	 	東   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 543   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 5   	Constituents: east, sun, day, tree, wood 	 	As a ""Western"" language, English identifies the east with the rising sun. In more fanciful terms, we see the sun piercing through a tree as it rises in the east. 	  * Both the direction east and the part of the world called ""the East"" are primitive meanings of this character. 	 	Traditionally seen as a pictograph of the sun rising behind a tree. 	 	On-Yomi: トウ   Kun-Yomi: ひがし  	Examples: 東 (ひがし)"
ridgepole	"ridgepole 	 	棟   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 544   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: ridgepole, tree, wood, east, tree, wood, sun, day, tree2, wood2 	 	If the piece of wood in the roof known as the ridgepole points east, the sunrise will be visible from the front door. 	 	 	Feng Shui states that the ridgepole of a house should be made of wood and face east. 	 	On-Yomi: トウ   Kun-Yomi: むね、むな-  	Examples: 棟 (むね)"
frozen	"frozen 	 	凍   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 545   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: frozen, ice, east, tree, wood, sun, day 	 	The whole secret to breaking the ice with the East is to peek behind those mysteriously ""frozen smiles."" 	 	 	Eastern Siberia is often frozen by ice. According to wikipedia, Yakutia (in Eastern Siberia) holds the record as the coldest town on Earth. Check it out yourself...it made it stick for me! 	 	On-Yomi: トウ   Kun-Yomi: こお.る、こご.える、こご.る、い.てる、し.みる  	Examples: 凍る (こお.る), 凍える (こご.える)"
pregnancy	"pregnancy 	 	妊   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 546   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: pregnancy, woman, porter, drop, samurai 	 	A woman who is in her pregnancy is a bit like a porter, bearing her new companion wherever she goes. 	 	 	A pregnant woman is a porter of her child. 	 	On-Yomi: ニン、ジン   Kun-Yomi: はら.む、みごも.る"
courts	"courts 	 	廷   	   	Lesson: 19   Frame: 547   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: courts, porter, drop, samurai, stretch 	 	Those who rule the courts, the porters of justice and order, are often found to stretch the law to suit their own purposes. Recall the kanji for prolong from frame 419 and keep it distinct. 	 	 	A porter has run away from his master. His punishment is to be stretched out on the rack. So say the courts in this barbaric time. 	 	On-Yomi: テイ   Kun-Yomi:"
dye	"dye 	 	染   	   	Lesson: 20   Frame: 548   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: dye, water, water droplets, water pistol, nine, baseball, tree, wood 	 	Water . . . nine . . . tree. From those elements you must compose a plot for the key word, dye. Here, as elsewhere, any of the alternate meanings of the primitives may be used, provided they do not require a position other than that of the kanji in question. 	 	 	To make this dye, I used water and the barks of nine different trees. 	 	On-Yomi: セン   Kun-Yomi: そ.める、-ぞ.め、-ぞめ、そ.まる、し.みる、-じ.みる、し.み、-し.める  	Examples: 染み (し.み), 染みる (し.みる), 染まる (そ.まる), 染める (そ.める)"
burn	"burn 	 	燃   	   	Lesson: 20   Frame: 549   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: burn, fire, sort of thing, moon, crescent moon, month, flesh, part of the body, chihuahua, dog, large, drop, oven-fire, barbecue, fire2 	 	Hearth . . . sort of thing. Beware of letting the simple reading off of the primitive elements do your work for you. Unless you make a vivid image of something burning and relate it just as vividly to those primitive meanings, you can count on forgetting this character very quickly. 	 	 	Any sort of thing can burn in the fire. 	 	On-Yomi: ネン   Kun-Yomi: も.える、も.やす、も.す  	Examples: 燃える (も.える), 燃す (も.す), 燃やす (も.やす)"
V.I.P.	"V.I.P. 	 	賓   	   	Lesson: 20   Frame: 550   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: V.I.P., house, one, ceiling, few, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	The V.I.P. indicated here is an important guest making a visit. The elements are: house . . . ceiling . . . few . . . shells. 	 	 	This house is reserved to V.I.P. only. If you are not one of the few with enough money to call you that way, keep out! 	 	On-Yomi: ヒン   Kun-Yomi:"
year-end	"year-end 	 	歳   	   	Lesson: 20   Frame: 551   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: year end, stop, footprint, one, little, small, march 	 	Stop . . . march . . . little. Be sure not to forget that final dot in the element for march. 	 	 	Santa had to put his foot down to stop a march of little guys, namely elves. They were protesting the harsh treatment they get every year-end when Santa asks them to step up toy production for the holiday season. 	 	On-Yomi: サイ、セイ   Kun-Yomi: とし、とせ、よわい  	Examples: 歳末 (さいまつ), 歳月 (さいげつ), 二十歳 (はたち)"
prefecture	"prefecture 	 	県   	   	Lesson: 20   Frame: 552   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: prefecture, eye, fishhook, small, little 	 	Above, an eye and a fishhook, and below the primitive for little. Although apparently the simplest of these first six kanji, when you begin to work on its plot and story you will soon find out that the number of strokes and visual complexity of a kanji does not make it easier or harder to remember. It is the primitives you have to work that are the critical factor, as in this case where the meaning of the key word is so seemingly distant from the elements. Remember, you can always break larger elements down (eye of a needle into eye and fishhook) if you think it helps. 	 	 	In Japanese this is KEN, as in Barbie´s boyfriend. He has lovely blue eyes, a girlfriend who is as thin as a straightened out fish hook. But, down where it counts, he has very little to show... 	 	On-Yomi: ケン   Kun-Yomi: か.ける"
horse chestnut	"horse chestnut 	 	栃   	   	Lesson: 20   Frame: 553   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT:    	Constituents: horse chestnut, tree, wood, Wimbledon, cliff, ten thousand, one, bound up 	 	A tree . . . cliff . . . ten thousand. 	 	 	There are a bunch of HORSE CHESTNUT TREES on top of this CLIFF above the beach. Chestnuts keep rolling off the cliff and falling on people´s heads. So far TEN THOUSAND people have been killed by falling chestnuts, and the Japanese government still ain´t did shit about it. 	 	On-Yomi:    Kun-Yomi: とち  	Examples: 栃 (とち)"
ground	"ground 	 	地   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 554   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: ground, soil, dirt, ground, scorpion 	 	Soil and a scorpion (an ""earth animal""). This is, of course, the full character from which the primitive for ground derives. 	 	 	Picture the ground as an extent of soil where scorpions are buried like land mines. Imagine a sign post saying ´no trespassing, scorpion mines´ if that helps, and how it is dangerous to walk there. 	 	On-Yomi: チ、ジ   Kun-Yomi:   	Examples: 地下 (ちか), 天地 (てんち), 境地 (きょうち)"
pond	"pond 	 	池   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 555   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: pond, water, water droplets, water pistol, scorpion 	 	Water . . . scorpion. It would be easy to slip into a ""lazy image"" in cases like this one, picturing, let us say, a scorpion near the water. But if you picture rather a scorpion letting its venom out drop by drop until it has made a whole pond of the stuff, the image is more likely to remain fixed. 	 	 	Remember the story of the scorpion that begged the turtle for a ride across the pond? Halfway across the water, the scorpion stung the turtle on the neck and they both sank to the bottom. 	 	On-Yomi: チ   Kun-Yomi: いけ  	Examples: 池 (いけ)"
insect	"insect 	 	虫   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 556   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 1   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: insect, in, stick, mouth 	 	Work with the pictograph as you wish. 	  * As a primitive, this insect will refer to the whole insect kingdom; it can be further specified for each kanji that contains it. 	 	I see the bottom of this kanji as an arm, and the top is an insect biting into the arm, sucking some blood. 	 	On-Yomi: チュウ、キ   Kun-Yomi: むし  	Examples: 虫 (むし)"
lightning bug	"lightning bug 	 	蛍   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 557   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: lightning-bug, schoolhouse, owl, crown, insect 	 	Schoolhouse . . . insect. 	 	 	Bugs have to go to school to learn how to become lightning bugs. Only the brightest bugs graduate to become lightning bugs. 	 	On-Yomi: ケイ   Kun-Yomi: ほたる  	Examples: 蛍 (ほたる)"
snake	"snake 	 	蛇   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 558   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: snake, insect, wind chimes, house, spoon, sitting on the ground 	 	Insect . . . house . . . spoon. 	 	 	A snake eats insects and he does that outside, while we eat another snake in the house and preferably with a spoon. 	 	On-Yomi: ジャ、ダ、イ、ヤ   Kun-Yomi: へび  	Examples: 蛇の目 (へびのめ), 蛇腹 (じゃばら), 大蛇 (おろち), 蛇 (へび)"
rainbow	"rainbow 	 	虹   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 559   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: rainbow, insect, craft 	 	Insect . . . craft. 	 	 	Little is it known that a rainbow is actually created by insects of different colours flying in formation, a craft they have perfected to create the rainbows we see today. 	 	On-Yomi: コウ   Kun-Yomi: にじ  	Examples: 虹 (にじ)"
butterfly	"butterfly 	 	蝶   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 560   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: butterfly, insect, Tarzan, generation, tree, wood 	 	Insect . . . generation . . . tree. 	 	 	A butterfly is an insect that appears after spending a generation on a tree as a cocoon. 	 	On-Yomi: チョウ   Kun-Yomi:"
single	"single 	 	独   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 561   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: single, pack of wild dogs, insect 	 	Think of this key word in connection with bachelorhood. The elements: wild dogs . . . insect. 	 	 	The bachelor´s apartment looked like it had been attacked by a pack of wild dogs. There were even insects in the kitchen. No wonder he´s single! 	 	On-Yomi: ドク、トク   Kun-Yomi: ひと.り  	Examples: 独り (ひと.り)"
silkworm	"silkworm 	 	蚕   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 562   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: silkworm, heavens, insect 	 	Heavens . . . insect. Be sure to do something about the position of the two elements. 	 	 	There are no insects in heaven - well, that is, except for silkworms. What, do you expect Jesus to import his fancy robes from China? 	 	On-Yomi: サン、テン   Kun-Yomi: かいこ、こ  	Examples: 蚕 (かいこ)"
wind	"wind 	 	風   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 563   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: wind, gnats, drop, insect 	 	Windy . . . drops of . . . insects. Hint: think of the last two primitives as representing a swarm of gnats, those tiny drops of pesky insects. 	 	 	They say that when an INSECT flaps its wings even the single DROP of WIND that it creates is sometimes enough to create a hurricane on the other side of the Earth. 	 	On-Yomi: フウ、フ   Kun-Yomi: かぜ、かざ-、-かぜ  	Examples: 風力 (ふうりょく), 風俗 (ふうぞく), 強風 (きょうふう), 風 (かぜ)"
self	"self 	 	己   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 564   Strokes: 3   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: self, snake, self 	 	The kanji carries the abstract sense of the self, the deep-down inner structure of the human person that mythology has often depicted as a snake - which is what the kanji shows pictographically. Be sure to keep it distinct from the similar keywords, oneself (frame 36) and I (frame 17). 	  * As a primitive element, this kanji can be used for the snake - of which it is a pictograph - or any of the various concrete symbolic meanings the snake has in myth and fable. 	 	This kanji looks like the ""s"" of ""self"", looking at its own reflection in a mirror (reversed sideways), as if pondering about his ""self"". 	 	On-Yomi: コ、キ   Kun-Yomi: おのれ、つちのと、な  	Examples: 自己 (じこ), 利己 (りこ), 己 (おのれ)"
rouse	"rouse 	 	起   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 565   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: rouse, run, soil, dirt, ground, mend, snake, self 	 	Run . . . snake. 	 	 	Be careful when you´re RUNNING through the jungle, because you might step on and ROUSE a sleeping SNAKE. Then you´ll have to RUN like hell before it bites you! 	 	On-Yomi: キ   Kun-Yomi: お.きる、お.こる、お.こす、おこ.す、た.つ  	Examples: 起きる (お.きる), 起こす (お.こす), 起こる (お.こる)"
queen	"queen 	 	妃   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 566   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: queen, woman, snake, self 	 	Woman . . . snake. 	 	 	Cleopatra. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒ   Kun-Yomi: きさき"
reformation	"reformation 	 	改   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 567   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: reformation, snake, self, taskmaster 	 	Pluralizing the snake and focusing on a single taskmaster may help recommend the image of Ireland's most famous reformer, St. Patrick, who, legend has it, drove away the snakes from the land. 	 	 	The taskmaster of Slytherin ( wizardry house symbolized by a snake ) plans a reformation of Hogwarts, disallowing the study of magic to all muggle-born. こわいですね！. 	 	On-Yomi: カイ   Kun-Yomi: あらた.める、あらた.まる  	Examples: 改まる (あらた.まる), 改める (あらた.める)"
scribe	"scribe 	 	記   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 568   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: scribe, say, words, keitai, mouth, snake, self 	 	Words . . . snake. 	 	 	A scribe writes down the words spoken by a snake (i.e. a lawyer). 	 	On-Yomi: キ   Kun-Yomi: しる.す  	Examples: 記す (しる.す)"
wrap	"wrap 	 	包   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 569   Strokes: 5   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: wrap, bound up, snake, self 	 	Bind up . . . snake. 	  * The primitive meaning of wrap should always be used with the snake in mind to avoid confusion with similar terms. Just let ""wrap"" mean ""with a snake coiled about it."" 	 	The snake bound up its prey by wrapping his body around it. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: つつ.む、くる.む  	Examples: 包む (つつ.む)"
placenta	"placenta 	 	胞   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 570   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: placenta, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, wrap, bound up, snake, self 	 	Part of the body . . . wrap. 	 	 	Imagine a newborn baby, fresh out of the womb, being entirely wrapped by the long piece of flesh, called a placenta, that once fed him. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi:"
cannon	"cannon 	 	砲   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 571   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: cannon, stone, rock, wrap, bound up, snake, self 	 	Stones . . . wrap. 	 	 	Primitive cannons fired stones wrapped with poisonous snakes. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi:"
bubble	"bubble 	 	泡   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 572   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: bubbles, water, water droplets, water pistol, wrap, bound up, snake, self 	 	Water . . . wrap. 	 	 	When water forms a bubble, it wraps a pocket of air. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: あわ  	Examples: 泡 (あわ)"
tortoise	"tortoise 	 	亀   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 573   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: tortoise, bound up, eels, sun, day 	 	This is not a turtle (See frame 250) but a tortoise, however you wish to picture the difference. Let the ""bound up"" at the to prefer to the head, and the two suns, with a long tail running through it, to the shell. 	  * As a primitive, this kanji is abbreviated to its bottom half, ⻲, and comes to mean eel. (If it is any help, this kanji in its full form can also be remembered through its abbreviation's primitive meaning.) 	 	It seems bizarre, but tortoises are a genetic cross with the head of a fish and the tail of an eel. Where the shell comes from, no one knows. 	 	On-Yomi: キ、キュウ、キン   Kun-Yomi: かめ  	Examples: 亀 (かめ)"
electricity	"electricity 	 	電   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 574   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 5   	Constituents: electricity, rain, weather, eel, sun, day 	 	Rain/weather . . . eel. 	 	 	Think of a two natural sources of electricity: electrical storms (a form of weather) and electrical eels. 電話 でんわ phone, call. 	 	On-Yomi: デン   Kun-Yomi:"
dragon	"dragon 	 	竜   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 575   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: dragon, vase, stand up, eel, sun, day 	 	Vase . . . eel. In order not to confuse this kanji with the zodiacal sign of the dragon, which we will meet later (Frame 2164) and use as a primitive, you might think here of a paper parade dragon. 	 	 	Have you ever seen an asian DRAGON? it looks like an eel, but can stand up because it has legs. 	 	On-Yomi: リュウ、リョウ、ロウ   Kun-Yomi: たつ、いせ"
waterfall	"waterfall 	 	滝   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 576   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: waterfall, water, water droplets, water pistol, dragon, vase, stand up, eel, sun, day 	 	Water . . . vase . . . eels. To avoid the confusion mentioned in the previous frame, the character learned there for dragon should not be used as a primitive. 	 	 	The Water Dragon dwells in the waterfall. 	 	On-Yomi: ロウ、ソウ   Kun-Yomi: たき  	Examples: 滝 (たき)"
pork	"pork 	 	豚   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 577   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: pork, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, sow, pig 	 	Flesh . . . sow. 	 	 	Pork comes from the flesh of a sow. 	 	On-Yomi: トン   Kun-Yomi: ぶた  	Examples: 豚 (ぶた)"
pursue	"pursue 	 	逐   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 578   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: pursue, sow, pig, road 	 	Sows . . . road. 	 	 	In association with consummate (#540), our sow is on the road pursuing a mate. 	 	On-Yomi: チク   Kun-Yomi:"
consummate	"consummate 	 	遂   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 579   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: consummate, horns, sow, pig, road 	 	The horns atop the sow suggest a boar at work in the background. Add the element for a road. Now create a story whose meaning is: consummate. 	 	 	This is still Miss Piggy only she´s gotten horny (as she often does) and now she´s pursuing Kermit to help her consummate her desires. 	 	On-Yomi: スイ   Kun-Yomi: と.げる、つい.に  	Examples: 遂げる (と.げる)"
house	"house 	 	家   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 580   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: house, sow, pig 	 	This is the full character whose primitive form we learned already. To help a little, this kanji recalls the times when the ""domestic"" animals were, as the word itself suggests, really kept in the house. Hence: house . . . sow. 	 	 	Think of ""The Three Little Pigs"". There was a house made of straw, another made of sticks, and a third made of bricks, each occupied by a pig. So, naturally, housetop over pig means house, the central element of that story. 	 	On-Yomi: カ、ケ   Kun-Yomi: いえ、や、うち  	Examples: 家屋 (かおく), 家庭 (かてい), 作家 (さっか), 家 (いえ), 家 (や)"
marry into	"marry into 	 	嫁   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 581   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: marry into, woman, house, sow, pig 	 	The kanji in this frame demonstrates the traditional Japanese approach to marriage: it is the woman who leaves her family for another household, thus marrying into a man's family. 	 	 	Since the Nihonjin man is hardly ever home, the woman feels more like she´s married into the house than into a relationship. 	 	On-Yomi: カ   Kun-Yomi: よめ、とつ.ぐ、い.く、ゆ.く  	Examples: 嫁ぐ (とつ.ぐ), 嫁 (よめ)"
overpowering	"overpowering 	 	豪   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 582   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: overpowering, tall, top hat, mouth, crown, sow, pig 	 	Tall . . . crowned . . . sow. 	 	 	In Orwell´s ´Animal Farm´ the pigs overpowered every other animals. They crownded themselves as ruler of the farm and walked tall on their rear legs, a crime strictly forbidden in the animal republic. 	 	On-Yomi: ゴウ   Kun-Yomi: えら.い"
intestines	"intestines 	 	腸   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 583   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: intestines, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 	 	Flesh . . . piggy bank. 	 	 	Intestines are the part of the body that is taken out of piglets to make piggy banks. Just imagine factory workers scraping out the intestines of real piglets and packaging them up for little children. 	 	On-Yomi: チョウ   Kun-Yomi: はらわた"
location	"location 	 	場   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 584   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: location, soil, dirt, ground, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 	 	Soil . . . piggy bank. 	 	 	You´re looking for a good location to bury your piggy bank savings. It has to be in some soft soil that´s easy to dig up, well hidden, and easy to remember like this kanji. 	 	On-Yomi: ジョウ、チョウ   Kun-Yomi: ば  	Examples: 場 (ば)"
hot water	"hot water 	 	湯   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 585   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: hot water, water, water droplets, water pistol, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets 	 	Water . . . piggy bank. 	 	 	Imagine a hot water kettle for your tea, except this one is a pink piggy bank that pours the water from its snout (and squeals when the water is piping hot). Make sure to use a potholder! 	 	On-Yomi: トウ   Kun-Yomi: ゆ  	Examples: 湯 (ゆ)"
sheep	"sheep 	 	羊   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 586   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: sheep, horns 	 	This pictograph shows the animal horns at the top attached to the head (3rd stroke), the front and back legs (strokes 4 and 5) and body (final stroke). 	  * The primitive meaning of sheep can add the further connotations given in the following frame. As we saw with the cow, the ""tail"" is cut off when it is set immediately over another element: ⺷. Note the change in stroke order, as exemplified in the following frame. 	 	Picture of a sheep run over by a steam roller. Must have been a ram, note the horns. 	 	On-Yomi: ヨウ   Kun-Yomi: ひつじ  	Examples: 羊 (ひつじ)"
beauty	"beauty 	 	美   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 587   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: beauty, sheep, large, St. Bernard 	 	Try to think of what the Chinese were on to when they associated the idea of beauty with a large sheep. 	 	 	I guess this kanji proves it´s not just the Welsh whose idea of beauty is a large sheep. 	 	On-Yomi: ビ、ミ   Kun-Yomi: うつく.しい  	Examples: 美しい (うつく.しい)"
ocean	"ocean 	 	洋   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 588   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: ocean, water, water droplets, water pistol, sheep 	 	Water . . . sheep. Be sure to keep the stories and key word of this kanji distinct from those for sea. (Frame 500). 	 	 	This kanji refers to the waters of the Pasheephic ocean. 	 	On-Yomi: ヨウ   Kun-Yomi:"
detailed	"detailed 	 	詳   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 589   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: detailed, say, words, keitai, mouth, sheep 	 	Words/speaking . . . sheep. 	 	 	Trembling from head to hoof from such a traumatic experience, the sheep gives a very detailed worded account to the detective about his wolf attack. ""We need more details Mr. Sheep. Tell us exactly where the baaad man touched you"". 	 	On-Yomi: ショウ   Kun-Yomi: くわ.しい、つまび.らか  	Examples: 詳しい (くわ.しい)"
fresh	"fresh 	 	鮮   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 590   Strokes: 17   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: fresh, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue, sheep 	 	Fish . . . sheep. 	 	 	The freshest fish is caught in the middle of the night while most people are ""counting sheep."" (If you´ve ever been to Tsukiji fish market, you know what I mean). 	 	On-Yomi: セン   Kun-Yomi: あざ.やか  	Examples: 鮮やか (あざ.やか)"
accomplished	"accomplished 	 	達   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 591   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: accomplished, soil, dirt, ground, sheep, road 	 	The key word is meant to connote someone ""skilled"" at something. On the road we find soil OVER a sheep. You may have to work with this one a while longer. 	 	 	Dolly (the first cloned sheep ever) grow tired of being a celebrity and escaped from the labs by digging a tunnel. She turned out to be an ACCOMPLISHED escapist, as she managed to dig a road under the soil. /Imagine Dolly performing a escape, like those movies where the main character has to escape from jail. 	 	On-Yomi: タツ、ダ   Kun-Yomi: -たち"
envious	"envious 	 	羨   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 592   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT:    	Constituents: envious, sheep, water, water droplets, water pistol, lack, yawn 	 	Sheep . . . water . . . yawn/lack. Although this character looks rather simple, special care should be taken in learning it because of the proximity of the final two elements to the character for next, which we learned in frame 510. Note, too, that the water comes UNDER the sheep, rather than on its own to the left. 	 	 	A very thirsty sheep, who always lacked water, spends his days watching his fellow sheep (in the farm next door or in another pen) and being very envious of their water. 	 	On-Yomi: セン、エン   Kun-Yomi: うらや.む、あまり  	Examples: 羨ましい (うらや.ましい), 羨む (うらや.む)"
distinction	"distinction 	 	差   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 593   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: distinction, wool, sheep, craft 	 	Wool . . . craft. 	 	 	This New-Zealand pro-gamer has won many distinctions playing WoolCraft (a massively multi-user game in which the goal is to shear sheep). 	 	On-Yomi: サ   Kun-Yomi: さ.す、さ.し  	Examples: 差す (さ.す)"
don	"don 	 	着   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 594   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: don, wool, sheep, eye 	 	I cannot resist doing this one for you, since it clearly describes donning (putting on) one's clothes as ""pulling the wool over one's eyes."" 	 	 	A pullover is donned by pulling wool over your eyes. 	 	On-Yomi: チャク、ジャク   Kun-Yomi: き.る、-ぎ、き.せる、-き.せ、つ.く、つ.ける  	Examples: 着用 (ちゃくよう), 着手 (ちゃくしゅ), 土着 (どちゃく), 着せる (き.せる), 着る (き.る), 着く (つ.く), 着ける (つ.ける)"
solely	"solely 	 	唯   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 595   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: solely, mouth, turkey 	 	Mouth . . . turkey. 	 	 	The mouth of a turkey is used solely for saying, ""Gobble."" Likewise, your mouth, full of turkey, is solely used to gobble it up. 	 	On-Yomi: ユイ、イ   Kun-Yomi: ただ  	Examples: 唯一 (ゆいいつ), 唯物論 (ゆいぶつろん), 唯美主義 (ただびしゅぎ)"
char	"char 	 	焦   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 599   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: char, turkey, oven-fire, barbecue 	 	Turkey . . . oven fire. 	 	 	When I put the turkey over the oven fire, it always ends up being charred beyond recognition. I´m not a very good cook. 	 	On-Yomi: ショウ   Kun-Yomi: こ.げる、こ.がす、こ.がれる、あせ.る  	Examples: 焦る (あせ.る), 焦がす (こ.がす), 焦がれる (こ.がれる), 焦げる (こ.げる)"
reef	"reef 	 	礁   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 600   Strokes: 17   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: reef, stone, rock, char, turkey, oven-fire, barbecue 	 	Rocks . . . char. 	 	 	Coral reefs are now dying off due to our abuse of the environment and now look like charred stone. For a picture illustrating this, see http://www.nacri.org/images/Hof-dredgingfig8.jpg. 	 	On-Yomi: ショウ   Kun-Yomi:"
gather	"gather 	 	集   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 601   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: gather, turkey, tree, wood 	 	Turkeys . . . atop a tree. 	 	 	Hunter-gathers, searching all along the ground for food. They never look up and see the Turkeys that have gathered on top of the trees to hide. Those were some smart turkeys! 	 	On-Yomi: シュウ   Kun-Yomi: あつ.まる、あつ.める、つど.う  	Examples: 集まる (あつ.まる), 集める (あつ.める), 集う (つど.う)"
quasi-	"quasi- 	 	准   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 602   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: quasi-, ice, turkey 	 	Ice . . . turkey. 	 	 	Quasi-modo, the famous hunchback of Notre-Dame wasn´t actually a hunchback at all!! He used a frozen turkey to make a hunch! 	 	On-Yomi: ジュン   Kun-Yomi:"
advance	"advance 	 	進   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 603   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: advance, turkey, road 	 	Turkey . . . road. 	 	 	Why did the turkey cross the road? To advance to the other side, of course. 	 	On-Yomi: シン   Kun-Yomi: すす.む、すす.める  	Examples: 進む (すす.む), 進める (すす.める)"
miscellaneous	"miscellaneous 	 	雑   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 604   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: miscellaneous, nine, baseball, tree, wood, turkey 	 	Baseball . . . trees . . . turkey. 	 	 	Newscast: ""Among today´s miscellaneous stories, we have a report on a baseball team that was chased up a tree by a turkey. Stay tuned for this and more!"". 	 	On-Yomi: ザツ、ゾウ   Kun-Yomi: まじ.える、まじ.る  	Examples: 雑談 (ざつだん), 雑音 (ざつおん), 混雑 (こんざつ)"
female	"female 	 	雌   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 605   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: feminine, Prince, this here, stop, footprint, spoon, sitting on the ground, turkey 	 	This character for female forms a pair with that for male, which we will learn later (Frame 804). The elements: footprint . . . spoon . . . turkey. 	 	 	Stop | spooning | turkeys. Spoon females. 	 	On-Yomi: シ   Kun-Yomi: め-、めす、めん  	Examples: 雌 (め), 雌 (めす)"
semi-	"semi- 	 	準   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 606   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: semi-, water, water droplets, water pistol, turkey, ten, needle 	 	Think of this in terms of the semifinals of some sports competition. Water . . . turkeys . . . needle. 	 	 	The anhinga, or water turkey, has a needle-like nose, so really it´s only a semi-turkey http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anhinga. 	 	On-Yomi: ジュン   Kun-Yomi: じゅん.じる、じゅん.ずる、なぞら.える、のり、ひと.しい、みずもり"
stirred up	"stirred up 	 	奮   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 607   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: stirred up, large, St. Bernard, turkey, rice field, brains 	 	St. Bernard dog . . . turkey . . . rice field/brains. 	 	 	The St. Bernard dog pounces on a turkey in a rice field and stirs up all the other birds around. See them all gobble gobbling in fear? 	 	On-Yomi: フン   Kun-Yomi: ふる.う  	Examples: 奮う (ふる.う)"
rob	"rob 	 	奪   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 608   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: rob, large, St. Bernard, turkey, glue 	 	Whereas burglary (Frame 381) implies clandestine appropriation of another's property, robbery refers to taking by force. The primitive elements: St. Bernard dog . . . turkey . . . glue. 	 	 	Remember the scene in A Christmas Story where the big dogs robbed the family of their Christmas turkey? Well, the following year Ralphie´s mom glued the holiday bird to the kitchen table, just as a precaution. 	 	On-Yomi: ダツ   Kun-Yomi: うば.う  	Examples: 奪う (うば.う)"
assurance	"assurance 	 	確   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 609   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: assurance, stone, rock, turkeyhouse, house, turkey 	 	On the left you see the rock, which is familiar enough. But pay attention to the right. Taking careful note of the unusual stroke order that has the ""chimney"" on the house doubled up with the first stroke of the turkey, we may see the right side as a turkey house (or ""coop""). We shall see this pattern only on one other occasion (Frame 2093), but even for these two characters it is well worth the trouble to single it out as a primitive. 	 	 	To assure that no one will get into the Turkey coop, put a huge rock in the entrance! 	 	On-Yomi: カク、コウ   Kun-Yomi: たし.か、たし.かめる  	Examples: 確か (たし.か), 確かめる (たし.かめる)"
noon	"noon 	 	午   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 610   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 5   	Constituents: noon, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse 	 	With a bit of stretching, you might see a horse's head pointing leftwards in this character. That gives the primary meaning of the Chinese zodiacal sign of the horse, which corresponds to the hour of noon. Note how this kanji primitive differs from that for cow (Frame 260). 	  * As a primitive, this character gets the meaning of a horse. Any horse image will do, except that of a team of horses, which will come later (Frame 2132) and get its own primitive. 	 	Noon is a good time for a ten minute nap (using lie down as nap). 	 	On-Yomi: ゴ   Kun-Yomi: うま"
permit	"permit 	 	許   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 611   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: permit, say, words, keitai, mouth, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse 	 	Words . . . horse. 	 	 	If horses could speak, you might have to ask their permission before mounting them. 	 	On-Yomi: キョ   Kun-Yomi: ゆる.す、もと  	Examples: 許す (ゆる.す)"
delight	"delight 	 	歓   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 612   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: delight, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey, lack, yawn 	 	Again I cannot resist sharing my own associations. If you've ever seen Disney's animated interpretation of classical music, ""Fantasia,"" you will recall what was done there with Beethoven's ""Pastoral Symphony"" (the 6th), and the flying horses that figured in it. The mares are bathing in the stream and the stallions begin to gather. As dusk sets in, the flying horses all start yawning and pair off for the night: a perfectly delightful portrait of delight. 	 	 	Imagine a spoiled little girl. Her delight when she gets a Pegasus for her birthday... and then like all spoilt little girls she gets bored of it quickly... hence the yawn. 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi: よろこ.ぶ"
authority	"authority 	 	権   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 613   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: authority, tree, wood, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey 	 	Tree . . . Pegasus. 	 	 	I have Eric Cartman of the “South Park” animated series, wearing a cop uniform, riding a wooden Pegasus (such as on a funfair), and yelling “RESPECT MY AUTHORITAH!!!”. 	 	On-Yomi: ケン、ゴン   Kun-Yomi: おもり、かり、はか.る  	Examples: 権利 (けんり), 権威 (けんい), 人権 (じんけん)"
outlook	"outlook 	 	観   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 614   Strokes: 18   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: outlook, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey, see, telescope, eye, human legs 	 	Pegasus . . . see. 	 	 	Microsoft Outlook works about as well as a pegasus that can´t see: they both crash all the time. 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi: み.る、しめ.す"
feathers	"feathers 	 	羽   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 615   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: feathers, wings 	 	From the pictograph of two bird-wings, we get feathers. 	  * The related image of wings can be added as a primitive meaning. It can also take the form ョョ when used as a primitive, as we shall see in frames 618 and 619. 	 	Pictograph. Easy enough. 	 	On-Yomi: ウ   Kun-Yomi: は、わ、はね  	Examples: 羽 (は), 羽 (はね)"
learn	"learn 	 	習   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 616   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: learn, feathers, wings, white, dove 	 	Feathers . . . white bird. 	 	 	Imagine a white bird loosing a couple feathers as it is learning to fly. You learn a lesson as you watch it doing so, maybe you learn that “nothing comes for free” or that “one has to be prepared to loose in order to gain”... 	 	On-Yomi: シュウ、ジュ   Kun-Yomi: なら.う、なら.い  	Examples: 習う (なら.う)"
the following	"the following 	 	翌   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 617   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: the following, feathers, wings, vase, stand up 	 	Feathers . . . vase. Be sure to contrast the connotation of this keyword with that for next (Frame 510). 	 	 	The following segment is sponsored by...Swiffer - who make excellent feather dusters for cleaning your vases. 	 	On-Yomi: ヨク   Kun-Yomi:"
weekday	"weekday 	 	曜   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 618   Strokes: 18   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: weekday, sun, day, futon, feathers, wings, turkey 	 	Day . . . feathers . . . turkey. 	 	 	Tip: feathers + turkey : This combination of primitives appears six times in Heisig, so it´s worthwhile giving it a name. I suggest ""futon"" (your futon is made from turkey feathers). REF: weekday (FRAME 576) , laundry (#577), leap (#1285), outstanding (#2272), twinkle (#2534), shimmering (#2880). Story: On weekdays you hang your futon out in the sun. 	 	On-Yomi: ヨウ   Kun-Yomi:"
laundry	"laundry 	 	濯   	   	Lesson: 21   Frame: 619   Strokes: 17   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: laundry, water, water droplets, water pistol, futon, feathers, wings, turkey 	 	Water . . . feathers . . . turkey 	 	 	At the laundry you stuff your large futon (made from turkey feathers) in the machine, thereby causing it to break -- as shown by the water spurting out the side. 	 	On-Yomi: タク   Kun-Yomi: すす.ぐ、ゆす.ぐ"
sayeth	"sayeth 	 	曰   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 620   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade:    JLPT:    	Constituents: sayeth, pent in, one 	 	Pent in . . . one. The key word refers to famous sayings of famous people, and is the origin for the primitive meaning of a tongue wagging in the mouth that we learned in frame 12. The size of this kanji, a relatively rare one, is what distinguishes it from day. 	 	 	Sayeth?! Who the hell says ""sayeth""? Doesn´t seem quite right...just like this kanji, which is just like ""day"" but doesn´t seem ""quite right."". 	 	On-Yomi: エツ   Kun-Yomi: いわ.く、のたま.う、のたま.わく、ここに、ひらび"
quandary	"quandary 	 	困   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 621   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: quandary, pent in, tree, wood 	 	Pent in . . . trees. 	 	 	I´m supposed to make an enclosure for my tree, but if I use its wood for the enclosure, there won´t be anything left to be pent-in. What a quandary! 	 	On-Yomi: コン   Kun-Yomi: こま.る  	Examples: 困る (こま.る)"
harden	"harden 	 	固   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 622   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: harden, pent in, old, tombstone, gravestone, church, ten, needle, mouth 	 	Old . . . pent in. Leave the people out of your story to avoid complications later when we add the element for person to form a new kanji (Frame 1047). 	 	 	Fossils are old things pent in that have hardened. 	 	On-Yomi: コ   Kun-Yomi: かた.める、かた.まる、かた.まり、かた.い  	Examples: 固い (かた.い), 固まる (かた.まる), 固める (かた.める)"
country	"country 	 	国   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 624   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 5   	Constituents: country, pent in, king, jewel, ball, earring, drop 	 	Jewels . . . pent in. 	 	 	In my country (England) the crown jewels are kept pent-in in the Tower of London. Which happens to be where enemies of the state were once also pent-in (probably for trying to steal those jewels). 	 	On-Yomi: コク   Kun-Yomi: くに  	Examples: 国 (くに)"
group	"group 	 	団   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 625   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: group, pent in, glue 	 	Glued . . . pent in. 	 	 	When you are admitted into a group like the Yakuza, you´re well and truly done (だん) for. You must stick to the group like glue, and you will be pent-in for life, never being able to leave. We once had a dog with big paws // and oh what great trouble he´d cause // we built a huge pen // to keep him pent in // and stop him from breaking more laws //. matrimony	"matrimony 	 	姻   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 627   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: matrimony, woman, cause, pent in, large, St. Bernard 	 	Woman . . . cause. Think here of the ""state of matrimony"" and you will not confuse it with other characters involving marriage, one of which we have already met (Frame 581). 	 	 	Matrimony is the state in which the woman has got you pent in like a dog so that you cannot go after other bitches. 	 	On-Yomi: イン   Kun-Yomi:"

-times	"-times 	 	回   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 630   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: times, pent in, mouth 	 	The suffix ""-times"" refers to a number of repetitions. Its elements: a mouth . . . pent in. Hint: you may find it more helpful to forget the primitives and think of one circle revovling inside of another. 	 	 	Write mouth two -times. 	 	On-Yomi: カイ、エ   Kun-Yomi: まわ.る、-まわ.る、-まわ.り、まわ.す、-まわ.す、まわ.し-、-まわ.し、もとお.る、か.える  	Examples: 回答 (かいとう), 転回 (てんかい), 次回 (じかい), 回す (まわ.す), 回る (まわ.る)"
podium	"podium 	 	壇   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 631   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: podium, soil, dirt, ground, Churchill, top hat, -times, pent in, mouth, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor 	 	Soil/ground . . . top hat . . . -times . . . nightbreak. With kanji as difficult as this one, it generally pays to toy with the various connotations of its primitives before settling on one image. Aim for as much simplicity as you can. 	 	 	A man on the podium announce the rules for the contest: You must fill a top hat with dirt as many times as you can by nightbreak. 	 	On-Yomi: ダン、タン   Kun-Yomi:   	Examples: 壇上 (だんじょう), 花壇 (かだん), 文壇 (ぶんだん)"

Try to remember all those stores from Zelda that were inside caves and had fortune-teller like vendors. 	 	On-Yomi: テン   Kun-Yomi: みせ、たな  	Examples: 店 (みせ)"

It´s a big cave that Batman uses as a warehouse to store his car, the Batmobile, and all his cool big-boy toys. 	 	On-Yomi: コ、ク   Kun-Yomi: くら  	Examples: 倉庫 (そうこ), 文庫 (ぶんこ), 車庫 (しゃこ)"

heart	"heart 	 	心   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 639   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: heart, drops, fishhook, heart 	 	This character, a pictographic representation of the heart, is among the most widely used primitives we shall meet. 	  * As a primitive, it can take three forms, to which we shall assign three distinct meanings. In its kanji-form, it appears BENEATH or to the RIGHT of its relative primitive and means th physical organ of the heart.  To the LEFT, it is abbreviated to three strokes, ⺖,  and means a wildly emotional state of mind. And finally, at the very BOTTOM, it can take the form ⺗, in which case we give it the meaning of a valentine. 	 	The four chambers in the heart. In the West, we point to our head when asked about the mind. In the East, they point to the heart. So then, the radical for ""state of mind""…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　シン　安心　あんしん(peace of mind). 	 	On-Yomi: シン   Kun-Yomi: こころ、-ごころ、りっしんべん  	Examples: 心 (こころ)"
forget	"forget 	 	忘   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 640   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: forget, perish, deceased, top hat, fishhook, heart 	 	Perish . . . heart. 	 	 	You only truly forget her when she has perished in your heart. 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ   Kun-Yomi: わす.れる  	Examples: 忘れる (わす.れる)"
endure	"endure 	 	忍   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 642   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: endure, blade, sword, dagger, drop, heart 	 	Blade . . . heart. Endure here means long-suffering patience. 	 	 	A ninja must be able to endure the pain of clinging to a ceiling, motionless, for hours at a time, waiting for just the right moment to drop down and thrust the blade of his sword into the hearts of his enemies. By the way, this character is used in the compound 忍者 (ninja) which is why I choose to use ninja as its primitive meaning. 	 	On-Yomi: ニン   Kun-Yomi: しの.ぶ、しの.ばせる  	Examples: 忍ばせる (しの.ばせる), 忍ぶ (しの.ぶ)"
acknowledge	"acknowledge 	 	認   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 643   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: acknowledge, say, words, keitai, mouth, endure, blade, sword, dagger, drop, heart 	 	Words . . . endure. 	 	 	You are given a speech about some serious mistakes of yours, and you have to endure the whole thing, because all you can do is acknowledge. 	 	On-Yomi: ニン   Kun-Yomi: みと.める、したた.める  	Examples: 認める (みと.める)"

grace	"grace 	 	恩   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 652   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: grace, cause, pent in, large, St. Bernard, heart 	 	Take grace in its sense of a favor freely bestowed, not in its meaning of charming manners or fluid movement. The primitives: cause . . . heart. 	 	 	Grace here is a favor freely bestowed, like a good deed. So to remember this kanji, go to the local shelter, find a big dog pent up in a small cage and adopt him. That will cause a warm feeling in your heart! 	 	On-Yomi: オン   Kun-Yomi:"
apply	"apply 	 	応   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 653   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: apply, cave, heart 	 	Cave . . . heart. The sense of the key word here is of something appropriate that fills a particular need, and hence ""applies."" 	 	 	In the videogame Zelda, Link enters a CAVE to visit a fairy that will APPLY magic to fill his HEART containers. 	 	On-Yomi: オウ、ヨウ、ノウ   Kun-Yomi: あた.る、まさに、こた.える"
idea	"idea 	 	意   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 654   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: idea, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, heart 	 	Sound . . . heart. 	 	 	When you get a good IDEA you get excited and you can hear the SOUND of your HEART, it´s pounding so hard. 	 	On-Yomi: イ   Kun-Yomi:"
concept	"concept 	 	想   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 656   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: concept, inter milan, inter, tree, wood, eye, heart 	 	To distinguish this kanji from that of the previous frame, focus on the sense of the ""con-"" in the word ""concept."" Its elements are: inter- . . . heart. 	 	 	The concept of love is basically two hearts inter-acting as one. 	 	On-Yomi: ソウ、ソ   Kun-Yomi: おも.う  	Examples: 想像 (そうぞう), 感想 (かんそう), 予想 (よそう)"

Your breath brings oxygen in through your nose which is then pumped around your body by your heart. 	 	On-Yomi: ソク   Kun-Yomi: いき  	Examples: 息 (いき)"
recess	"recess 	 	憩   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 658   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: recess, tongue, thousand, mouth, nose, drop, eye, heart 	 	Tongue . . . nose . . . heart. The sense of breath from the last frame should not be used; it could lead you to put only the nose over the heart and leave the tongue off to one side. 	 	 	Recess to me is a school break. At recess some kiddies are comparing their latest body piercings. Tongues and noses are nothing special. The new cool is to have your heart done! 	 	On-Yomi: ケイ   Kun-Yomi: いこ.い、いこ.う  	Examples: 憩い (いこ.い), 憩う (いこ.う)"
favor	"favor 	 	恵   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 659   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: favor, ten, needle, rice field, brains, heart 	 	Ten . . . fields (or: needle . . . brains) . . . heart. 	 	 	Too easy. Imagine the Wizard of OZ. There, the three heroes asked the Wizard for three FAVORS: the lion wanted courage of TEN men, the scarecrow wanted a BRAIN, and the tin man wanted a HEART. Ok, the lion bit is stretching but you have it memorized now, so who cares? 	 	On-Yomi: ケイ、エ   Kun-Yomi: めぐ.む、めぐ.み  	Examples: 恵贈 (けいぞう), 恵与 (けいよ), 恩恵 (おんけい), 恵む (めぐ.む)"

If your heart surgeon is mediocre in his craft, you have plenty of reason to fear. (""Oops, I think I left my scissors in there""). beguile	"beguile 	 	惑   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 661   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: beguile, a, pope, fiesta, mouth, one, floor, heart 	 	The first three elements, fiesta . . . mouth . . . floor, appeared together once already in frame 380. Beneath them, once again, the heart. 	 	 	She was beguiled/mislead by his charm: at the party he kissed her on the mouth, they did it on the floor and thus he stole her heart. Poor girl! emotion	"emotion 	 	感   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 662   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: emotion, march, mouth, heart 	 	Mouths . . . marching . . . heart. 	 	 	Emotion is a march of mouths inside your heart telling you what to feel. 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi:"
melancholy	"melancholy 	 	憂   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 663   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: melancholy, summer, head, page, crown, heart, walking legs 	 	Head . . . crown . . . heart . . . walking legs. Two things merit mention here. First, the doubling-up of the last stroke of head with the top of the crown serves to make the whole more aesthetically beautiful. It happens so rarely that the exceptions are easily learned. Second, try to make a single image out of the four elements. (Religious statuary of melancholy figures should offer plenty of suggestions.) 	 	 	Melancholy makes me think of Hamlet cause he was so ´emo´. In order to play up his feelings he bares his head and holds his crown over his heart then walks (on walking legs) around the palace making everyone see how melancholy he is. What a wuss. 	 	On-Yomi: ユウ   Kun-Yomi: うれ.える、うれ.い、う.い、う.き  	Examples: 憂い (う.い), 憂い (うれ.い), 憂える (うれ.える)"
widow	"widow 	 	寡   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 664   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: widow, house, head, page, animal legs, eight, sword, dagger 	 	House . . . head . . . dagger. Immediately we get another instance of a very odd exception. Notice how the final stroke of the head is lengthened, giving the final two strokes a chance to stretch out and make room for the dagger that fits in beneath. 	 	 	The new widow sits in the house, her head in her lap (the extended stroke), her dagger in her husband. 	 	On-Yomi: カ   Kun-Yomi:"
busy	"busy 	 	忙   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 665   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: busy, Freud, state of mind, deceased, perish, top hat, fishhook 	 	State of mind . . . perish. 	 	 	Busy (as in ""occupied"") means a state of mind where all other thoughts are perished. 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ、モウ   Kun-Yomi: いそが.しい、せわ.しい、おそ.れる、うれえるさま  	Examples: 忙しい (いそが.しい)"
ecstasy	"ecstasy 	 	悦   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 666   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: ecstasy, Freud, state of mind, devil, horns, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs 	 	State of mind . . . devil. 	 	 	ECSTASY alters our STATE OF MIND and makes us DEVILS. 	 	On-Yomi: エツ   Kun-Yomi: よろこ.ぶ、よろこ.ばす"
constancy	"constancy 	 	恒   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 667   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: constancy, Freud, state of mind, span, one, ceiling, sun, day, one, floor, one 	 	State of mind . . . span. 	 	 	Constancy is holding the same state of mind over a long span of time. (tweaking PepeSeco and mspertus). 	 	On-Yomi: コウ   Kun-Yomi: つね、つねに"
lament	"lament 	 	悼   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 668   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: lament, Freud, state of mind, eminent, magic wand, augury, sun, day, ten, needle 	 	To keep this character distinct from others of similar connotation, one need only think of the Prophet Jeremiah whose poetry gave an eminence to the state of mind we call lamentation. 	 	 	When the world´s most eminent magician died, everyone´s state of mind became that of lamentation. He was buried with his famous sun-flower wand in his hand. 	 	On-Yomi: トウ   Kun-Yomi: いた.む  	Examples: 悼む (いた.む)"
enlightenment	"enlightenment 	 	悟   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 669   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: enlightenment, Freud, state of mind, I, five, mouth 	 	I know of an Indian religious sect which teaches that enlightenment is to be had by covering the eyes with one's index fingers, the ears with the thumbs, and the mouth with the little fingers. While these differ a bit from the five holes that we used to represent the ""I"" (frame 17), the idea of achieving a special state of mind by covering those five places can help you learn this kanji. You might try the position out while you are learning this character. 	 	 	Enlightenment is a state of mind that goes beyond the five senses. 	 	On-Yomi: ゴ   Kun-Yomi: さと.る  	Examples: 悟る (さと.る)"
dreadful	"dreadful 	 	怖   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 670   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: dreadful, Freud, state of mind, linen, by one’s side, towel 	 	State of mind . . . linen. 	 	 	Someone in a dreadful state of mind has crawled into his bed and is hiding under the sheets (linens). 	 	On-Yomi: フ、ホ   Kun-Yomi: こわ.い、こわ.がる、お.じる、おそ.れる  	Examples: 怖い (こわ.い)"

(re: wazzab) The state of mind of the people of New Orleans as they examined their city´s concert hall laid waste can best described as disconcerted. 	 	On-Yomi: コウ   Kun-Yomi: あわ.てる、あわ.ただしい  	Examples: 慌ただしい (あわ.ただしい), 慌てる (あわ.てる)"

For all have sinned... so everyone´s state of mind should be to repent. 	 	On-Yomi: カイ   Kun-Yomi: く.いる、く.やむ、くや.しい  	Examples: 悔いる (く.いる), 悔やむ (く.やむ), 悔しい (くや.しい)"

Like the saying goes, Hate just begets Hate. A state of mind that just increases and increases until it explodes. 	 	On-Yomi: ゾウ   Kun-Yomi: にく.む、にく.い、にく.らしい、にく.しみ  	Examples: 憎い (にく.い), 憎しみ (にく.しみ), 憎む (にく.む), 憎らしい (にく.らしい)"

It took him awhile, but Data finally got ACCUSTOMED to his nipple/breast piercings. They were constantly rubbing up against his shirt and his heart-shaped locket. Picture Data, shirtless, squeezing his nipples in front of Picard and saying ""Yes, at first they were a bit shelly, but I´ve grown quite ACCUSTOMED to them"". That last bit should do it for you. 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi: な.れる、な.らす  	Examples: 慣らす (な.らす), 慣れる (な.れる)"
pleasure	"pleasure 	 	愉   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 675   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: pleasure, Freud, state of mind, meeting, umbrella, butchers, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, sword, sabre, saber 	 	State of mind . . . butchers (See frame 307). 	 	 	At the meeting of butchers, in their narrow state of mind, they throw lame jokes around like, ´Oh hello, it´s a pleasure to meat you´, and find this rather pleasing. 	 	On-Yomi: ユ   Kun-Yomi: たの.しい、たの.しむ"

When I am in a LAZY state of mind I use my left hand to play with my meat...it feels like someone else is doing it, which is good cause I´m to lazy to get a date. 	 	On-Yomi: ダ   Kun-Yomi:"

remorse	"remorse 	 	憾   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 678   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: remorse, Freud, state of mind, emotion, march, mouth, heart 	 	State of mind . . . emotion. Hint: the etymology of ""remorse"" indicates a memory that returns again and again to ""bite at"" one's conscience and disturb one's peace of mind. 	 	 	Remorse is the state of mind where I feel bad for what I did while I was tired and emotional! 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi: うら.む"

pining	"pining 	 	慕   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 683   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: pining, graveyard, flowers, sun, day, large, St. Bernard, valentine 	 	Graveyard . . . valentine. Note carefully the stroke order of the valentine primitive. 	 	 	Pining, yearn for... etc. Presumably for lost love. An easy one here, someone standing in the graveyard, placing an old valentine card amonst all the existing tributes. 	 	On-Yomi: ボ   Kun-Yomi: した.う  	Examples: 慕う (した.う)"
annexed	"annexed 	 	添   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 684   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: annexed, water, water droplets, water pistol, heavens, valentine 	 	Water . . . heavens . . . valentine. 	 	 	Hawaii is a little drop of heaven nestled in the waters of the Pacific, most often visited by honeymooners and valentines. It was annexed to the U.S.A. in 1959, and more recently to Japan as well-- albeit only unofficially, and through private commercial holdings. 	 	On-Yomi: テン   Kun-Yomi: そ.える、そ.う、も.える、も.う  	Examples: 添う (そ.う), 添える (そ.える)"
invariably	"invariably 	 	必   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 685   Strokes: 5   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: invariably, heart, stick, drop, fishhook, drop3 	 	First note the stroke order of this character, which did not really evolve from the heart, even though we take it that way. If one takes it as a pictograph ""dividing"" the heart in half, then one has one of those invariably true bits of human anatomy: the fact that each heart is divided into two halves. 	 	 	You swear you´ll be in love forever, but invariably there comes a time when your heart is divided. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒツ   Kun-Yomi: かなら.ず  	Examples: 必ず (かなら.ず)"
ooze	"ooze 	 	泌   	   	Lesson: 22   Frame: 686   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: ooze, water, water droplets, water pistol, invariably, heart, stick, drop, fishhook, drop3 	 	Water . . . the invariably divided heart. 	 	 	Anything full of water will invariably begin to ooze. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒツ、ヒ   Kun-Yomi:   	Examples: 分泌 (ぶんぴつ)"
hand	"hand 	 	手   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 687   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: 1   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: hand 	 	Any way you count them, there are either too many or too few fingers to see a good pictograph of a hand in this character. But that it is, and so you must. 	  * Keep to the etymology when using this kanji as a primitive: a single hand all by itself. 	 	This pictograph actually really works if you look at it as a hand with fingers spread and middle finger pointing down. see the very top stroke as the edge of a shirt cuff, and it will all come together. 	 	On-Yomi: シュ、ズ   Kun-Yomi: て、て-、-て、た-  	Examples: 手 (て)"
watch over	"watch over 	 	看   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 688   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: watch over, hand, eye 	 	Hand . . . eyes. 	 	 	It´s a hot day of summer with a clear sky, you´re sitting outside a cafe (or maybe on a reclining chair in the garden), and you watch over the kids with a hand covering your eyes from the sunlight (next time, don´t forget the sunglasses). 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi: み.る"
chafe	"chafe 	 	摩   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 689   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: chafe, hemp, cave, grove, tree, wood, hand, tree2, wood2 	 	Hemp . . . hand. 	 	 	If you grind the hemp without a stone but use your hand instead it will chafe. (Image: ""Robin, why are your hands all chafed?"" ´Uh... (I´ve been grinding hemp all day)´). ego	"ego 	 	我   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 690   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: ego, hand, fiesta 	 	Hand . . . fiesta. Note how the second stroke of the hand is stretched across to double up as the first stroke of the tasseled arrow we use for fiesta. Compare to frames 17, 36, and 564. 	 	 	Someone with a huge EGO is too good for any romantic partner and as such has nothing but personal ""hand fiestas"" with himself every night. 	 	On-Yomi: ガ   Kun-Yomi: われ、わ、わ.が-、わが-  	Examples: 我 (わ), 我 (われ)"

rub	"rub 	 	抹   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 694   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: rub, finger, fingers, extremity, one, tree, wood 	 	Fingers . . . extremity. 	 	 	I like to RUB my FINGERS over my EXTREMITIES ....like my extremity-ly long, umm, hair.... This has been edited in response to being reported ...you can change ""hair"" to whatever extremity-ly long body part you like. 	 	On-Yomi: マツ   Kun-Yomi:"
embrace	"embrace 	 	抱   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 697   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: embrace, finger, fingers, wrap, bound up, snake, self 	 	Fingers . . . wrap. 	 	 	When embracing someone, wrap your fingers around her butt for added effect. You may think of ""bound with snakes"" as a description of the fingers slithering around the buttocks, if you want a particularly graphic image. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: だ.く、いだ.く、かか.える  	Examples: 抱く (いだ.く), 抱える (かか.える), 抱く (だ.く)"
board	"board 	 	搭   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 698   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: board, finger, fingers, flowers, fit, meeting, umbrella, one, mouth 	 	The key word refers to boarding vessels for travel. Its elements are: finger . . . flowers . . . fit together (See frame 270). 	 	 	Ok, this is a little wierd, but i took this back to the kanji for pagoda (#254). I think it helps simplify the image, and also helps anchor the pagoda kanji in memory better as an added bonus. say this aloud once, and i think it will bring out a vivid image very quickly: ""Now boarding the pagoda ride. Please keep your fingers inside at all times..."". 	 	On-Yomi: トウ   Kun-Yomi:"

Gandalf confronts the evil beast, shouting ""you shall not pass!"". He holds up a single finger and sends forth a whirlwind. 	 	On-Yomi: コウ   Kun-Yomi:"

You´re using a hammer to drive a nail into a plank, but you miss and strike your fingers, ouch ! PS: the character does not mean ""to go on strike"", it will be very helpful in the long run to create images that convey the proper sense of the character! conjecture	"conjecture 	 	推   	   	Lesson: 23   Frame: 716   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: conjecture, finger, fingers, turkey 	 	Fingers . . . turkey. 	 	 	In mathematics, a conjecture is a mathematical statement which has been proposed as a true statement, but which no one has yet been able to prove or disprove. Have you heard of the Finger-Turkey conjecture ? It states that if turkeys had fingers, they would be able to count. Be sure to imagine a turkey with fingers at the tip of its wings, counting from one to ten. 	 	On-Yomi: スイ   Kun-Yomi: お.す  	Examples: 推す (お.す)"

My piggy bank is so heavy that I cannot HOIST it using just my fingers. 	 	On-Yomi: ヨウ   Kun-Yomi: あ.げる、-あ.げ、あ.がる  	Examples: 揚がる (あ.がる), 揚げる (あ.げる)"

When a man PROPOSES to a lady, he takes her FINGER and places the ring on it JUST SO, and the moment sweeps her away. 	 	On-Yomi: テイ、チョウ、ダイ   Kun-Yomi: さ.げる  	Examples: 提げる (さ.げる)"
