Like in Memento, I tattoo my address on my forearm flesh so I don´t forget it. 	 	On-Yomi: ワン   Kun-Yomi: うで  	Examples: 腕 (うで)"
garden	"garden 	 	苑   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1523   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: garden, flowers, mailbox, evening, fingerprint 	 	Flowers . . . mailbox. 	 	 	Japanese ""gardens"" aren´t anything more than a pot of flowers on top of the mailbox. 	 	On-Yomi: エン、オン   Kun-Yomi: その、う.つ"
grudge	"grudge 	 	怨   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1524   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT:    	Constituents: grudge, mailbox, evening, fingerprint, heart 	 	Mailbox . . . heart. 	 	 	I couldn´t drop my grudge against him. So I put a severed pig´s heart in his mailbox. He got the message. 	 	On-Yomi: エン、オン、ウン   Kun-Yomi: うら.む、うらみ、うら.めしい"
willow	"willow 	 	柳   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1525   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: willow, tree, wood, blown eggs, sign of the hare, receipt, stamp 	 	Tree . . . receipt . . . stamp. 	 	 	Having decided to use SIGN OF THE HARE rather than RECEIPT and STAMP my mnemonic goes as follows: The WILLOW is the TREE that droops likes a HARE´s ears. 	 	On-Yomi: リュウ   Kun-Yomi: やなぎ  	Examples: 柳 (やなぎ)"
egg	"egg 	 	卵   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1526   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: egg, sign of the hare, receipt, stamp, drops 	 	Receipt . . . stamp . . . and a drop in each side to represent a little smear of egg yoke. The third stroke is drawn slightly higher to close the egg up tightly and keep the yoke inside. 	 	 	The Easter Bunny dropped an egg on my desk and got yolk all over my receipts and stamps. 	 	On-Yomi: ラン   Kun-Yomi: たまご  	Examples: 卵 (たまご)"
detain	"detain 	 	留   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1527   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: detain, receipt, sword, dagger, rice field, brains 	 	Receipt . . . dagger . . . rice field. 	 	 	The use of RANSOM NOTE (think of a receipt with a dagger through it on a door) works great with DETAIN. Here the RANSOM NOTE says that the girl has been DETAINED in an undisclosed location. To get her back take the RANSOM to a empty FIELD. 	 	On-Yomi: リュウ、ル   Kun-Yomi: と.める、と.まる、とど.める、とど.まる、るうぶる  	Examples: 留意 (りゅうい), 留学 (りゅうがく), 保留 (ほりゅう), 留まる (と.まる), 留める (と.める)"
trade	"trade 	 	貿   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1529   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: trade, receipt, sword, dagger, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Receipt . . . dagger . . . shells. Though the meanings are related, do not confuse with make a deal (Frame 471) or wholesale (Frame 1499). 	 	 	There´s a buyback program where you can trade in your dagger for money. But it´s quite ineffective, since only registered dagger-owners with the original receipts can participate, and not criminals with illegally-purchased daggers. 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ   Kun-Yomi:"
stamp	"stamp 	 	印   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1530   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: stamp, staples, stamp 	 	At last we come to the general character meaning stamp. Its elements: staples . . . stamp. 	 	 	Before sticky backs, they had to staple stamps to letters. 	 	On-Yomi: イン   Kun-Yomi: しるし、-じるし、しる.す  	Examples: 印 (しるし)"
entertain	"entertain 	 	興   	   	Lesson: 37   Frame: 1533   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: entertain, staples, same, monks, hood, one, mouth, tool, animal legs, eight 	 	Mortar . . . same . . . tool. Be careful to make an image that keeps same in the middle. 	 	 	To me, this looks like a pictograph of a road leading to the big city (see the buildings?) where there are plenty of places to be entertained. Unfortunately in this city, every store is the same: staples. What tools! [ayoung24]. 	 	On-Yomi: コウ、キョウ   Kun-Yomi: おこ.る、おこ.す  	Examples: 興行 (こうぎょう), 復興 (ふっこう), 振興 (しんこう), 興す (おこ.す), 興る (おこ.る)"
sign of the bird	"sign of the bird 	 	酉   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1534   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: sign of the bird, whiskey bottle, west, one 	 	Though we shall later encounter the kanji for bird, we introduce this one for the tenth sign of the zodiac mainly because of its use as a primitive, where it has a different meaning. 	  * As a primitive, it means whiskey bottle. In its pictograph, you can see the loosely corked lid, the bottle and the contents (about one-third full). You might also think of the Spanish ""porrón,"" a decanter shaped like a long-necked bird. 	 	The sign of the bird on this whiskey bottle is of course the Famous Grouse blended Scotch. 	 	On-Yomi: ユウ   Kun-Yomi: とり"
saké	"saké 	 	酒   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1535   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: sake, water, water droplets, water pistol, whiskey bottle 	 	Water . . . whiskey bottle. 	 	 	Sake is just watered down whisky. 	 	On-Yomi: シュ   Kun-Yomi: さけ、さか-  	Examples: 酒 (さけ)"
bartending	"bartending 	 	酌   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1536   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: bartending, whiskey bottle, ladle 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . ladle. 	 	 	At the local pub, their bartending practises are unusual. They serve the whiskey by pouring it from a ladle, like one would from the punch bowl. 	 	On-Yomi: シャク   Kun-Yomi: く.む  	Examples: 酌む (く.む)"
fermentation	"fermentation 	 	酵   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1538   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: fermentation, whiskey bottle, filial piety, old man, child 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . filial piety. 	 	 	The secrets of fermentation are passed to the son who displays the most filial piety. 	 	On-Yomi: コウ   Kun-Yomi:"
cruel	"cruel 	 	酷   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1539   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: cruel, whiskey bottle, revelation, cow, mouth 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . revelation. 	 	 	It´s cruel to pour alcohol down a cow´s mouth. 	 	On-Yomi: コク   Kun-Yomi: ひど.い"
repay	"repay 	 	酬   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1540   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: repay, whiskey bottle, state, stream, drop, drop3 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . state. 	 	 	Imagine a different kind of tax refund - instead of money, the state repays you with whiskey. 	 	On-Yomi: シュウ、シュ、トウ   Kun-Yomi: むく.いる"
dairy products	"dairy products 	 	酪   	   	Lesson: 38 &nbsp; Frame: 1541 &nbsp; Strokes: 13 &nbsp; &mdash; &nbsp; Jouyou Grade: JH &nbsp; JLPT: 1   	Constituents: dairy products, whiskey bottle, each, walking legs, mouth 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . each. 	 	 	Imagine if at each supermarket you went to, the section for dairy products was next to the alcohol aisle. so for each wheel of cheese you decide to buy, you get an accompanying bottle of wine...perfect for a ""wine & cheese"" party. :). 	 	On-Yomi: ラク &nbsp; Kun-Yomi:"
vinegar	"vinegar 	 	酢   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1542   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: vinegar, whiskey bottle, saw 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . saw. 	 	 	Drinking alcohol that´s turned to vinegar feels like a saw going down your throat. 	 	On-Yomi: サク   Kun-Yomi: す  	Examples: 酢 (す)"
drunk	"drunk 	 	酔   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1543   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: drunk, whiskey bottle, ninety, nine, baseball, ten, needle 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . baseball . . . needle. 	 	 	God you´re drunk! How many whiskeys did you have? 9? 10? 	 	On-Yomi: スイ   Kun-Yomi: よ.う、よ.い、よ  	Examples: 酔う (よ.う)"
distribute	"distribute 	 	配   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1544   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: distribute, whiskey bottle, snake, self 	 	Whisky bottle . . . snake. 	 	 	To DISTRIBUTE WHISKY during Prohibition you had to be as sneaky as a SNAKE. 	 	On-Yomi: ハイ   Kun-Yomi: くば.る  	Examples: 配る (くば.る)"
acid	"acid 	 	酸   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1545   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: acid, whiskey bottle, streetwalker, Ministry of silly walks, John Cleese, license, elbow, human legs, walking legs 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . license . . . walking legs. 	 	 	The prostitute carries an old whiskey bottle filled with acid to throw at any difficult Johns. 	 	On-Yomi: サン   Kun-Yomi: す.い  	Examples: 酸い (す.い)"
waver	"waver 	 	猶   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1546   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: furthermore, waver, pack of wild dogs, chieftain, Molotov cocktail, animal horns, whiskey bottle 	 	Wild dogs . . . animal horns . . . whiskey bottle. 	 	 	The waver for this kanji means to hesitate. I wavered before going into the bar with a bunch of horned wild dogs drinking whiskey straight out of the bottle. 	 	On-Yomi: ユウ、ユ   Kun-Yomi: なお"
revered	"revered 	 	尊   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1547   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: revered, chieftain, Molotov cocktail, animal horns, whiskey bottle, glue 	 	Animal horns . . . whiskey bottle . . . glue. 	 	 	People don't know this, but (""revered"" patriot) Paul Revere had trouble staying awake during his midnight ride, so he drank Red Bull (horns) and whiskey (a drink invented by his friend Sam Adams) and glued himself DOWN to the saddle. [thanks to akahige]. 	 	On-Yomi: ソン   Kun-Yomi: たっと.い、とうと.い、たっと.ぶ、とうと.ぶ  	Examples: 尊い (たっと.い), 尊ぶ (たっと.ぶ), 尊い (とうと.い), 尊ぶ (とうと.ぶ)"
beans	"beans 	 	豆   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1548   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: beans, table, one, mouth 	 	This kanji depicts a pot of beans, although it looks more like a table on which the pot is resting. 	  * As a primitive, this kanji will mean table. 	 	If I eat BEANS, after ONE MOUTHful I fart like some kind of HORNED ANIMAL. 	 	On-Yomi: トウ、ズ   Kun-Yomi: まめ、まめ-  	Examples: 豆腐 (とうふ), 納豆 (なっとう), 豆 (まめ)"
head	"head 	 	頭   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1549   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: head, beans, table, one, mouth, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Here we meet at last the full kanji on which the primitive for head is based. The elements: table . . . head. 	 	 	The head of the family sits at the head of the table. 	 	On-Yomi: トウ、ズ、ト   Kun-Yomi: あたま、かしら、-がしら、かぶり  	Examples: 頭部 (とうぶ), 年頭 (ねんとう), 船頭 (せんどう), 頭脳 (ずのう), 頭上 (ずじょう), 頭痛 (ずつう), 頭 (あたま), 頭 (かしら)"
short	"short 	 	短   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1550   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: short, dart, drop, heavens, beans, table, one, mouth 	 	Dart . . . table. 	 	 	He is so short so he has to throw darts from the table. 	 	On-Yomi: タン   Kun-Yomi: みじか.い  	Examples: 短い (みじか.い)"
bountiful	"bountiful 	 	豊   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1551   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: bountiful, bend, beans, table, one, mouth 	 	Bend . . . table. Think of a bountiful harvest, and you will not be far from the meaning of this character. 	 	 	The bountiful feast was so bountiful that it bent the table below it under its weight! いただきま〜す！. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ、ブ   Kun-Yomi: ゆた.か、とよ  	Examples: 豊 (ゆたか)"
drum	"drum 	 	鼓   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1552   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: drum, samurai, beans, table, one, mouth, branch, ten, needle, crotch 	 	The full kanji for the drum adds a branch, apparently to serve as a drumstick, to the primitive for drum. 	 	 	Japanese festivals have drums so big, a samurai has to SIT (not stand) on a table to beat one with a tree branch! http://www.d2.dion.ne.jp/~hidafyh/furukawayh/gyouji/image/maturi03.jpg. 	 	On-Yomi: コ   Kun-Yomi: つづみ  	Examples: 鼓 (つづみ)"
rejoice	"rejoice 	 	喜   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1553   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: rejoice, drum, samurai, beans, table, one, mouth, mouth, mouth2 	 	Drum . . . mouth. 	 	 	The samurai sitting on the drum is on a stage, and the people below him are rejoicing with their mouths in unison. It helps me to imagine the placement this way. 	 	On-Yomi: キ   Kun-Yomi: よろこ.ぶ、よろこ.ばす  	Examples: 喜ぶ (よろこ.ぶ)"
timber-trees	"timber-trees 	 	樹   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1554   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: timber-trees, tree, wood, drum, samurai, beans, table, one, mouth, glue 	 	Trees . . . drum . . . glue. 	 	 	The hippies object to trees being cut down for timber. They have glued themselves to the timber-trees and are beating their drums. 	 	On-Yomi: ジュ   Kun-Yomi: き"
dish	"dish 	 	皿   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1555   Strokes: 5   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: dish 	 	The kanji for a dish is, clearly, the pictograph of a painted or carved bowl, seen from the side. 	 	 	Three dishes stacked side-by-side in a dishwasher. 	 	On-Yomi: ベイ   Kun-Yomi: さら  	Examples: 皿 (さら)"
blood	"blood 	 	血   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1556   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: blood, drop, dish 	 	The drop in the dish is blood. It is similar to the drop we saw earlier on the dagger in the character for blade (Frame 88). 	 	 	Vampire orders blood in one of those posh restaurants. Imagine his shock when all he gets is a giant white bowl and just a single drop of blood in the centre and a drizzling of balsamic around the edge. Disgusted he calls the manager over tells him its overpriced tosh and bites into his neck with a huge gush of blood spraying everywhere. 	 	On-Yomi: ケツ   Kun-Yomi: ち  	Examples: 血 (ち)"

In order to form alliances, you should sit down for a meal and eat until your dish is bright or clear; in other words, get to know people first, before you talk business. 	 	On-Yomi: メイ   Kun-Yomi:"

As with silver, when this element is drawn on the left, the penultimate stroke is omitted. 	 	With a drop of silver, the forces of good can vanquish the werewolves. eat	"eat 	 	食   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1582   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 5   	Constituents: eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver 	 	If halo and umbrella aren't enough, break the halo down into drop and silver - or ""silverware,"" an additional primitive. 	  * As a primitive, this kanji can mean either eating or food. As with silver, on the left the final two strokes of this element are combined into one. 	 	That umbrella looks good enough to eat! 	 	On-Yomi: ショク、ジキ   Kun-Yomi: く.う、く.らう、た.べる、は.む  	Examples: 食事 (しょくじ), 食料 (しょくりょう), 会食 (かいしょく), 食う (く.う), 食らう (く.らう), 食べる (た.べる)"

After I eat a meal, I always have to take an anti-acid. 	 	On-Yomi: ハン   Kun-Yomi: めし  	Examples: 飯 (めし)"

Bldg.	"Bldg. 	 	館   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1589   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: Bldg., eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver, bureaucrat, house, maestro without baton 	 	The abbreviation of Building suggests that this kanji is used in proper names, as indeed it often is. Keep your connotation distinct from Inst. (Frame 1401) when working with the elements: food . . . bureaucrat. 	 	 	This Bldg. is like all the other government buildings - they house bureaucrats who sit around sipping wine and eating expensive meals at the taxpayers expense. 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi: やかた、たて"
foster	"foster 	 	養   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1591   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: foster, sheep, eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver 	 	Sheep . . . food. The key word has the sense of promoting the development of something, especially in a psychological or spiritual sense. 	 	 	A sheep became the foster parent for a wolf pup, feeding it with milk. This story cannot end well... 	 	On-Yomi: ヨウ、リョウ   Kun-Yomi: やしな.う  	Examples: 養う (やしな.う)"
sated	"sated 	 	飽   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1592   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: sated, eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver, wrap, bound up, snake, self 	 	Eat . . . wrap. 	 	 	My gluttony was only sated after I ate the hamburger AND the wrapper! 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: あ.きる、あ.かす、あ.く  	Examples: 飽かす (あ.かす), 飽きる (あ.きる)"
previously	"previously 	 	既   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1593   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: previously, silver, waitress 	 	Silver . . . waitress. Do not confuse this kanji's key word with before (Frame 263). 	 	 	Distinguish from formerly (#501). Think of previously as ""the previous customer"" in a restaurant. At a cheap sleazy diner, the waitress gives you unwashed silverware that was previously used by the previous customer. Yuck. 	 	On-Yomi: キ   Kun-Yomi: すで.に  	Examples: 既に (すで.に)"
outline	"outline 	 	概   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1594   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: outline, roots, tree, wood, silver, waitress, previously 	 	Roots . . . waitress. Note that the kanji meaning of the two primitives to the right is not used here because we shall later meet a primitive meaning beforehand and want to preempt any confusion. The same holds true in the following frame. 	 	 	The police tried to draw a chalk outline around the dead waitress, but it was kinda tough with all the tree roots underneath her. 	 	On-Yomi: ガイ   Kun-Yomi: おうむ.ね"
rue	"rue 	 	慨   	   	Lesson: 38   Frame: 1595   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: rue, regret, resentment, Freud, state of mind, silver, waitress, previously 	 	Resentment . . . waitress. 	 	 	If you don´t leave some silver as a tip, you will rue the day you earned the resentment of your waitress. 	 	On-Yomi: ガイ   Kun-Yomi:"
even	"even 	 	平   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1596   Strokes: 5   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: even, water-lily, lily pad 	 	This character is easiest remembered as a pictograph of a water lily floating on the surface of the water, which gives it its meaning of even. The fourth stroke represents the calm, smooth surface of a pond, and the final stroke the long stem of the plant reaching underwater. 	  * As a primitive, this kanji can keep its pictographic meaning of a water lily. 	 	There´s an even covering of water lilies on the pond at 金閣寺（きんかくじ） the Golden Pavilion in Kyoto. 	 	On-Yomi: ヘイ、ビョウ、ヒョウ   Kun-Yomi: たい.ら、-だいら、ひら、ひら-  	Examples: 平面 (へいめん), 平和 (へいわ), 公平 (こうへい), 平ら (たい.ら), 平 (ひら)"
call	"call 	 	呼   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1597   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: call, mouth, even, water-lily, lily pad, question mark 	 	Mouth . . . water lily. Note: this is the one time that the ""stem"" has a barb at the end. Work this fact into your story. 	 	 	'Budd' - 'weis' - 'er' call the frogs mouths from the liliy pads, working to get you hooked on beer. 	 	On-Yomi: コ   Kun-Yomi: よ.ぶ  	Examples: 呼ぶ (よ.ぶ)"
two-mat area	"two-mat area 	 	坪   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1598   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: two-mat area, soil, dirt, ground, even, water-lily, lily pad 	 	This kanji belongs to an old Japanese system of measurement and indicates an area of about 36 square feet, or the area taken up by two tatami mats. Its elements: ground . . . water lily. 	 	 	A two-mat area is just about as much ground as you will need for a lily pond. 	 	On-Yomi: ヘイ   Kun-Yomi: つぼ  	Examples: 坪 (つぼ)"
evaluate	"evaluate 	 	評   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1599   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: evaluate, say, words, keitai, mouth, even, water-lily, lily pad 	 	Words . . . water lily. 	 	 	Good evaluation should always be words of even fairness. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒョウ   Kun-Yomi:"
reap	"reap 	 	刈   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1600   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: reap, sheaf, sword, sabre, saber 	 	Sheaf . . . saber. 	 	 	A SABRE is used to cut the stalks of plants being REAPED at harvest. They are then combined into a SHEAF. 	 	On-Yomi: ガイ、カイ   Kun-Yomi: か.る  	Examples: 刈る (か.る)"
hope	"hope 	 	希   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1602   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: hope, sheaf, linen, by one’s side, towel 	 	Sheaf . . . linen. 	 	 	I hope this works, you say as you stuff a sheaf of stalks under your blanket but above your linens. Your real hope is that your parents don´t find out that you left the house. 	 	On-Yomi: キ、ケ   Kun-Yomi: まれ"
villain	"villain 	 	凶   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1603   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: villain, sheaf, shovel 	 	Sheaf . . . shovel. 	 	 	Here the villain digs a hole with a shovel and covers it with a sheaf, hoping someone will fall in. 	 	On-Yomi: キョウ   Kun-Yomi:"
bosom	"bosom 	 	胸   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1604   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: bosom, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, bound up, villain, sheaf, shovel 	 	Part of the body . . . bound up . . . villain. 	 	 	Just think of the heroine's bosom in a movie. The villain ties up the heroine (to the traintracks or the conveyor belt etc) but her bosom is the body part that is always left sticking out. 	 	On-Yomi: キョウ   Kun-Yomi: むね、むな-  	Examples: 胸 (むね)"
detach	"detach 	 	離   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1605   Strokes: 18   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: detach, sheik, top hat, villain, sheaf, shovel, belt, elbow, turkey 	 	Top hat . . . villain . . . belt . . . elbow . . . turkey. This is potentially one of the most difficult characters to remember. Tackle it positively and let the image ""sink in"" by carrying it around with you today and calling it up in your spare moments. 	 	 	I´ve finally met my arch-rival, the evilest of all villains. Finally, I´m about to fight him. But what´s this? He´s suspiciously quiet. I move to attack him, and his right arm falls off at the elbow. Strange. I walk up to him and detach his left arm. Very strange. I undo his belt, and take off his top hat... BLAST! It was just a decoy turkey! 	 	On-Yomi: リ   Kun-Yomi: はな.れる、はな.す  	Examples: 離す (はな.す), 離れる (はな.れる)"
kill	"kill 	 	殺   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1607   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: kill, sheaf, tree, wood, cruise missile, missile, wind, crotch 	 	Sheaf . . . tree . . . missile. 	 	 	X marks the spot on the tree where the missile hit. No doubt, it was meant to kill us. 	 	On-Yomi: サツ、サイ、セツ   Kun-Yomi: ころ.す、-ごろ.し、そ.ぐ  	Examples: 殺人 (さつじん), 殺到 (さっとう), 黙殺 (もくさつ), 相殺 (そうさい), 殺す (ころ.す)"
genuine	"genuine 	 	純   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1609   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: genuine, thread, spiderman, earthworm, drop, shovel, fishhook 	 	Thread . . . earthworm. 	 	 	For remembering the primitive earthworm: Drops of rain were falling so I took my shovel to dig up some earthworms to put them on my fishook..... My story: To have a genuine fishing line you don't just pick up a stick but you also attach some thread onto it and at the end an earthworm must be hung. 	 	On-Yomi: ジュン   Kun-Yomi:"
dull	"dull 	 	鈍   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1611   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: dull, metal, gold, earthworm, drop, shovel, fishhook 	 	Metal . . . earthworm. 	 	 	The metal hook is too dull to even pierce an earthworm.... 	 	On-Yomi: ドン   Kun-Yomi: にぶ.い、にぶ.る、にぶ-、なま.る、なまく.ら  	Examples: 鈍い (にぶ.い), 鈍る (にぶ.る)"
spicy	"spicy 	 	辛   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1612   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle 	 	This character pictures food whose taste is so hot and spicy that it makes the hairs on your body stand up as straight as needles. 	  * As a primitive, we shall use this meaning of spicy, except when the two extra strokes are added to the bottom, giving it the form of a tree. Then we take its alternate meaning of a red pepper plant. The connection is obvious. 	 	Eating spicy food makes you stand up ten times faster than usual, ´cause you just need to get something to drink! 	 	On-Yomi: シン   Kun-Yomi: から.い、つら.い、-づら.い、かのと  	Examples: 辛い (から.い)"
resign	"resign 	 	辞   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1613   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: resign, tongue, thousand, mouth, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle 	 	Tongue . . . spicy. 	 	 	This guy´s job is tasting the spicy curry at the local Indian Food Factory. He has to resign from his job before his tongue is rendered completely useless after all the spicy food that he has to try all day long... 	 	On-Yomi: ジ   Kun-Yomi: や.める、いな.む  	Examples: 辞める (や.める)"
catalpa	"catalpa 	 	梓   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1614   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: catalpa, tree, wood, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle 	 	Tree . . . spicy. 	 	 	The CATALPA is the tree that bears the SPICY Indian bean (NOTE - The Catalpa is also known as the ""Indian Bean"" due to the bean pods that grow from it). 	 	On-Yomi: シ   Kun-Yomi: あずさ"

The superintendent of a Japanese school district needs a spicy relationship at home after watching girls in miniskirts all day. 	 	On-Yomi: サイ   Kun-Yomi:"
wall	"wall 	 	壁   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1616   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: wall, ketchup, flag, mouth, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle, soil, dirt, ground 	 	Ketchup . . . ground. 	 	 	Did anyone else used to put ketchup packets on the ground and jump on them so they spattered on the wall? 	 	On-Yomi: ヘキ   Kun-Yomi: かべ  	Examples: 壁 (かべ)"
evade	"evade 	 	避   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1618   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: evade, ketchup, flag, mouth, spicy, stand up, vase, ten, needle, road 	 	Ketchup . . . road. 	 	 	You can try and evade them, but they´ll ketchup with you on the road... Sorry, couldn´t resist it. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒ   Kun-Yomi: さ.ける、よ.ける  	Examples: 避ける (さ.ける)"
new	"new 	 	新   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1619   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: new, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, axe 	 	Red pepper . . . ax. 	 	 	Don't confuse left primitive with catalpa (#1498). Every time the farmer cuts down the peppers from the red pepper plant, he has to use a brand new axe. This is because the spicy peppers cause the metal to erode very quickly, thereby rendering the axe completely useless. 	 	On-Yomi: シン   Kun-Yomi: あたら.しい、あら.た、あら-、にい-  	Examples: 新しい (あたら.しい), 新た (あら.た), 新 (にい)"
firewood	"firewood 	 	薪   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1620   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: fuel, firewood, flowers, new, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, axe 	 	Flowers . . . new. 	 	 	New flowers grow in areas of forests which have been chopped down for firewood. 	 	On-Yomi: シン   Kun-Yomi: たきぎ、まき  	Examples: 薪 (たきぎ)"
parent	"parent 	 	親   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1621   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: parent, red pepper, stand up, vase, tree, wood, see, telescope, eye, human legs 	 	Red pepper . . . see. 	 	 	A wise parent lets their kids learn. A kid wants to try to eat the red pepper plant, the wise parent says ""Try it and see for yourself"". 	 	On-Yomi: シン   Kun-Yomi: おや、おや-、した.しい、した.しむ  	Examples: 親 (おや), 親しい (した.しい), 親しむ (した.しむ)"
happiness	"happiness 	 	幸   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1622   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, ten, needle, ten2, needle2 	 	Simply by turning the dot at the top of the primitive for spicy into a cross shape, we move from things bitter and spicy to things happy. 	 	 	Happiness adds a bit (or ten) of spice to your life. 	 	On-Yomi: コウ   Kun-Yomi: さいわ.い、さち、しあわ.せ  	Examples: 幸い (さいわ.い), 幸 (さち), 幸せ (しあわ.せ)"
tenacious	"tenacious 	 	執   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1623   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: tenacious, happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, fat man, musashimaru, nine, baseball, drop, ten2, needle2 	 	Happiness . . . fat man. 	 	 	Tenacious-D is happy band led by a fat man. (It´s Tenacious-D time, ya muthafucka´, gwaoh!). 	 	On-Yomi: シツ、シュウ   Kun-Yomi: と.る  	Examples: 執務 (しつむ), 執筆 (しっぴつ), 確執 (かくしつ), 執る (と.る)"
report	"report 	 	報   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1625   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: report, happiness, ten, needle, stand up, vase, underpants, stamp, crotch, ten2, needle2 	 	Happiness . . . stamp . . . crotch. Compare frame 1501. 	 	 	Recall the fashion model wearing just a stamp over his crotch (clothing (#1399)). When he got happy, of course, it ended up in the news report. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: むく.いる  	Examples: 報いる (むく.いる)"
shout	"shout 	 	叫   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1626   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: shout, mouth, cornucopia 	 	Mouth . . . cornucopia. 	 	 	There was a man in a village who had a special gift : whenever he shouted and screamed, his mouth became a cornucopia, overflowing with fruits and food of all sorts. Many of the locals thought he was a cruel man, always screaming at his wife, until they realised he was in fact very kind, and his gift brought prosperity to his family. 	 	On-Yomi: キョウ   Kun-Yomi: さけ.ぶ  	Examples: 叫ぶ (さけ.ぶ)"
twist	"twist 	 	糾   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1627   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: twist, thread, spiderman, cornucopia 	 	Thread . . . cornucopia. 	 	 	A cornucopia is a twisted goat's horn decorated with coloured threads. 	 	On-Yomi: キュウ   Kun-Yomi: ただ.す"
income	"income 	 	収   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1628   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: income, cornucopia, crotch 	 	Cornucopia . . . crotch. Keep distinct from both fare (Frame 1079) and salary (Frame 1449). 	 	 	Prostitutes can make a veritable cornucopia of income by using their crotches -- they put the ""come"" in ""income."" (A bit lewd perhaps, but effective in keeping this character distinct from similar keywords like profit (#906) or earnings (#893)). 	 	On-Yomi: シュウ   Kun-Yomi: おさ.める、おさ.まる  	Examples: 収まる (おさ.まる), 収める (おさ.める)"
lowly	"lowly 	 	卑   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1629   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: lowly, Wayne Slob, drop, rice field, brains, cornucopia, ten, needle 	 	A drop of . . . brains . . . cornucopia. 	 	 	Lowly people only have a drop of brains and use nothing but 4-letter words. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒ   Kun-Yomi: いや.しい、いや.しむ、いや.しめる  	Examples: 卑しい (いや.しい), 卑しむ (いや.しむ), 卑しめる (いや.しめる)"
tombstone	"tombstone 	 	碑   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1630   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: tombstone, stone, rock, lowly, Wayne Slob, drop, rice field, brains, cornucopia, ten, needle 	 	Rock . . . lowly. 	 	 	There is a grave of a lowly man with a tombstone made of a simple, small stone. If you bow really low you can read the very small inscription engraved on the stone, it says - “Now that you bowed so low to read this, you are as lowly as I once was”. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒ   Kun-Yomi: いしぶみ"
land	"land 	 	陸   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1631   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: land, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, soil2, dirt2, ground2 	 	The sense of land carried by this kanji is distinct from soil (Frame 161) and ground (Frame 554) in that it is meant to represent land seen from a distance, that is, land as opposed to ""water."" Its elements: pinnacle . . . rice seedlings . . . ground. 	 	 	My rice-seedlings have become sentient and will go on a mission. I can only apologise for the next 6 frames. In the distance, there is a pinnacle, which the newly-awakened rice-seedlings who are still stuck in the ground can see. Could it be the Promised Land? 	 	On-Yomi: リク、ロク   Kun-Yomi: おか"
intimate	"intimate 	 	睦   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1632   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: intimate, eye, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, soil2, dirt2, ground2 	 	Eye . . . rice seedlings . . . ground. 	 	 	The farmer was never very intimate with his wife. He always kept his eye on his precious rice seedlings in the soil. 	 	On-Yomi: ボク、モク   Kun-Yomi: むつ.まじい、むつ.む、むつ.ぶ"
forces	"forces 	 	勢   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1633   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: forces, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, fat man, musashimaru, round, nine, baseball, drop, power, muscle, arnold, soil2, dirt2, ground2 	 	Rice seedlings . . ground . . . fat man . . . muscle. 	 	 	What power makes rice seedlings in the ground grow into well rounded plants? The forces of nature. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ゼイ   Kun-Yomi: いきお.い、はずみ  	Examples: 勢い (いきお.い)"
heat	"heat 	 	熱   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1634   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: heat, mini-tractor, rice seedlings, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, fat man, musashimaru, round, nine, baseball, drop, oven-fire, barbecue, soil2, dirt2, ground2 	 	Rice seedlings . . . ground . . . fat man . . . oven fire. 	 	 	Heat up those RICE SEEDLINGS you pulled from the SOIL in a ROUND pan over a low FLAME. (Note: the hot pan image helps reinforce the idea that this kanji for ""atsui"" refers to something hot to the touch, as opposed to hot weather). 	 	On-Yomi: ネツ   Kun-Yomi: あつ.い  	Examples: 熱い (あつ.い)"
diamond	"diamond 	 	菱   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1635   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT:    	Constituents: diamond, flowers, Mao, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, walking legs 	 	Named after a diamond-shaped flower (the water caltrop), this key word refers to things shaped like a diamond. Its elements: flower . . . rice seedlings . . . walking legs. 	 	 	Some girls want diamonds, but others will be satisfied with just flowers. However if you think you can win her over with rice seedlings, expect her to get up on her walking legs and walk on out! 	 	On-Yomi: リョウ   Kun-Yomi: ひし"
mausoleum	"mausoleum 	 	陵   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1636   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: mausoleum, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, Mao, soil, dirt, ground, human legs, walking legs 	 	Pinnacle . . . rice seedlings . . . walking legs. 	 	 	Ancient Japanese built a mausoleum for the ""unknown rice farmer"". It's on the pinnacle of Mt. Fuji, and it has a statue of a guy with huge walking legs planting rice seedlings as he goes. 	 	On-Yomi: リョウ   Kun-Yomi: みささぎ  	Examples: 陵 (みささぎ)"
sign of the hog	"sign of the hog 	 	亥   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1637   Strokes: 6   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: sign of the hog, acorn, top hat 	 	This kanji is the 12th sign of the Chinese zodiac: the sign of the hog. It is best learned by thinking of an acorn-eating hog in connection with the primitive meaning given below. 	  * The top hat represents the external shape of the acorn, and the unusual but easily written complex of strokes beneath it (which you might also see as distortions of an elbow and person) stands for the mysterious secret whereby the acorn contains the oak tree in a nutshell. 	 	A greedy hog in a top hat who has eaten all of the acorns. He even elbows people out of the way to get them. 	 	On-Yomi: ガイ、カイ   Kun-Yomi: い"
nucleus	"nucleus 	 	核   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1638   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: nucleus, tree, wood, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat 	 	Tree . . . acorn. 	 	 	In the nucleus of the acorn, all the DNA is stored -- the building blocks for a new tree. 	 	On-Yomi: カク   Kun-Yomi:"
engrave	"engrave 	 	刻   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1639   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: engrave, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat, sword, sabre, saber 	 	Acorn . . . saber. 	 	 	This famous ninja (I always use ninjas with sabres, distinct from samurai) used to engrave the kanji for his name onto acorns, and throw the acorns to distract his enemies. The legend goes that by the time his victims would pick up the acorn and read the engraved kanji, they were already dead. 	 	On-Yomi: コク   Kun-Yomi: きざ.む、きざ.み  	Examples: 刻む (きざ.む)"
above-stated	"above-stated 	 	該   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1640   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: above-stated, say, words, keitai, mouth, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat 	 	Words . . . acorn. 	 	 	I asked my teacher what this strange word meant, and she furiously replied that it was explained in the above-stated paragraph before throwing an acorn at me! 	 	On-Yomi: ガイ   Kun-Yomi:"
censure	"censure 	 	劾   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1642   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: censure, sign of the hog, acorn, top hat, power, muscle, arnold 	 	Acorn . . . muscle. 	 	 	Censure is the political equivalent of a ""strongly worded letter,"" according to Cornell's School of Law. It is a flex of muscle by congress against the current president, but it is a very weak one. Imagine censure as congress flexing as hard as it can, only to have a little acorn-sized bump of muscle pop up suddenly. 	 	On-Yomi: ガイ   Kun-Yomi:"
mention	"mention 	 	述   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1643   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: mention, resin, pole, road 	 	Resin . . . road. 	 	 	Why are the roads leading through the woods so sticky and dirty? Hmm... I think the forest ranger mentioned something about excess resin on the roads... 	 	On-Yomi: ジュツ   Kun-Yomi: の.べる  	Examples: 述べる (の.べる)"
art	"art 	 	術   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1644   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: art, boulevard, going, resin, pole 	 	Boulevard . . . resin. 	 	 	Behold the ""Boulev´Art"" : a life-size section of a boulevard cast in a huge block of resin. Some call it ... art. 	 	On-Yomi: ジュツ   Kun-Yomi: すべ"
cold	"cold 	 	寒   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1645   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: cold, Baba Yaga’s hut, house, celery, animal legs, ice 	 	House . . . celery . . . animal legs . . . ice. 	 	 	Don't mix up with cool (#1404), when the cool boys order each other around. This kind of cold has to do with weather. When its cold outside, I stay at home and have hot celery soup with chicken legs to keep out the ice. 寒い　＝　さむい　＝cold. 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi: さむ.い  	Examples: 寒い (さむ.い)"
brew	"brew 	 	醸   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1647   Strokes: 20   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: brew, whiskey bottle, grass skirt, top hat, eight, six, animal legs, celery, scarf 	 	Whiskey bottle . . . grass skirt. 	 	 	Grass Skirt primitive: Picture some Hawaiian girls, wearing grass skirts and tropical scarfs (or leis), doing a dance. ""3, 4, 5, 6 pick up all the celery sticks!"". defer	"defer 	 	譲   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1648   Strokes: 20   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: defer, say, words, keitai, mouth, grass skirt, top hat, eight, six, animal legs, celery, scarf 	 	Words . . . grass skirt. 	 	 	Speaking complicated words to set her head spinning, the island girl in the grass skirt says demurely ""I defer (yield) to your judgment, wise one"". lot	"lot 	 	壌   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1649   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: lot, soil, dirt, ground, grass skirt, top hat, eight, six, animal legs, celery, scarf 	 	Ground . . . grass skirt. The lot of this key word refers to a portion of land. 	 	 	My dream is to buy a small lot on a tropical island and spend the rest of my days relaxing in a grass skirt. 	 	On-Yomi: ジョウ   Kun-Yomi: つち"
lass	"lass 	 	嬢   	   	Lesson: 39   Frame: 1650   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: lass, woman, grass skirt, top hat, eight, six, animal legs, celery, scarf 	 	Woman . . . grass skirt. 	 	 	Conversation at a party: A: ""Who is that lass?"" B: ""Which one?"" A: ""The woman wearing the grass skirt."" B: ""Alas, I don´t know"". 	 	On-Yomi: ジョウ   Kun-Yomi: むすめ"
poison	"poison 	 	毒   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1651   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: poison, grow up, mother, breasts 	 	Grow up . . . breasts. 	 	 	If you grow up with a mother that drinks and smokes, you can be sure it´s poison in the stuff you get from her breasts. 	 	On-Yomi: ドク   Kun-Yomi:"
elementary	"elementary 	 	素   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1652   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: elementary, grow up, thread, spiderman 	 	Grow up . . . thread. 	 	 	This kanji has nothing to do with elementary school - it means element, elemental, basic, bare. Imagine the thread as a thread connecting all life, starting from the basic elements and growing up into everything. 	 	On-Yomi: ソ、ス   Kun-Yomi: もと  	Examples: 素材 (そざい), 元素 (げんそ), 平素 (へいそ)"
barley	"barley 	 	麦   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1653   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: barley, grow up, walking legs 	 	Grow up . . . walking legs. 	 	 	BARLEY beverages give GROWN UPs teetering WALKING LEGS. 	 	On-Yomi: バク   Kun-Yomi: むぎ  	Examples: 麦 (むぎ)"
blue	"blue 	 	青   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1654   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 1   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: blue, grow up, moon, flesh 	 	Grow up . . . moon. 	 	 	The last time I saw a blue moon was in my youth when I was growing up. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ショウ   Kun-Yomi: あお、あお-、あお.い  	Examples: 青天 (せいてん), 青銅 (せいどう), 青年 (せいねん), 青 (あお), 青い (あお.い)"
refined	"refined 	 	精   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1655   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: refined, rice, blue, grow up, moon, flesh 	 	Rice . . . blue. 	 	 	Very refined people in the upper classes have skin as pale as rice and blue blood. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ショウ、シヤウ   Kun-Yomi:   	Examples: 精米 (せいまい), 精密 (せいみつ), 精力 (せいりょく)"
solicit	"solicit 	 	請   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1656   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: solicit, say, words, keitai, mouth, blue, grow up, moon, flesh 	 	Words . . . blue. 	 	 	People who try to solicit you to buy things come up to you and just start taking out of the blue  	 	On-Yomi: セイ、シン、ショウ   Kun-Yomi: こ.う、う.ける  	Examples: 請求 (せいきゅう), 請願 (せいがん), 申請 (しんせい), 請ける (う.ける), 請う (こ.う)"
feelings	"feelings 	 	情   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1657   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: feelings, Freud, state of mind, blue, grow up, moon, flesh 	 	State of mind . . . blue. Do not confuse with emotion (Frame 662). 	 	 	Data is feeling blue about not having any feelings ... hey, wait a minute. 	 	On-Yomi: ジョウ、セイ   Kun-Yomi: なさ.け  	Examples: 情報 (じょうほう), 情熱 (じょうねつ), 人情 (にんじょう), 情け (なさ.け)"
clear up	"clear up 	 	晴   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1658   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: clear up, sun, day, blue, grow up, moon, flesh 	 	Take the key word in its associations with the weather (unless that tempts you to include the primitive for weather, which doesn't belong here). Its elements: sun . . . blue. 	 	 	Sun and blue sky! Yep, the weather´s cleared up! 	 	On-Yomi: セイ   Kun-Yomi: は.れる、は.れ、は.れ-、-ば.れ、は.らす  	Examples: 晴らす (は.らす), 晴れる (は.れる)"
pure	"pure 	 	清   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1659   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: pure, water, water droplets, water pistol, blue, grow up, moon, flesh 	 	Water . . . blue. 	 	 	Pure sea water is always a radiant blue. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ショウ、シン   Kun-Yomi: きよ.い、きよ.まる、きよ.める  	Examples: 清潔 (せいけつ), 清算 (せいさん), 粛清 (しゅくせい), 清い (きよ.い), 清まる (きよ.まる), 清める (きよ.める)"
quiet	"quiet 	 	静   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1660   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: quiet, blue, grow up, moon, flesh, contend, bound up, rake 	 	Blue . . . contend. Do not confuse with calm (Frame 1230). 	 	 	When someone you know who is normally talkative goes quiet, it´s usually a sign that they are contending with the blues. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ジョウ   Kun-Yomi: しず-、しず.か、しず.まる、しず.める  	Examples: 静止 (せいし), 静穏 (せいおん), 安静 (あんせい), 静 (しず), 静か (しず.か), 静まる (しず.まる), 静める (しず.める)"
blame	"blame 	 	責   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1661   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Grow up . . . oyster. 	 	 	As one grows up, one typically starts to blame all of their problems on money. 	 	On-Yomi: セキ   Kun-Yomi: せ.める  	Examples: 責める (せ.める)"
exploits	"exploits 	 	績   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1662   Strokes: 17   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: exploits, thread, spiderman, blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Thread . . . blame. 	 	 	Spidey´s exploits are world famous but still The Daily Bugle´s pages blame him for every problem out there. 	 	On-Yomi: セキ   Kun-Yomi:"
volume	"volume 	 	積   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1663   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: volume, wheat, cereal, blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Wheat . . . blame. This key word has to do with measurement, and should be kept distinct from the kanji for quantity (Frame 189) - even though the meanings are similar. 	 	 	On many wheat cereal boxes, there is a disclaimer stating that ""This package is sold by weight, not by volume. Some settling of contents may have occurred."" well they only say that because they don´t want to be blamed by people getting really disappointed after they see what a small volume of cereal the box really contains. 	 	On-Yomi: セキ   Kun-Yomi: つ.む、-づ.み、つ.もる、つ.もり  	Examples: 積む (つ.む), 積もる (つ.もる)"
bond	"bond 	 	債   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1664   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: bond, person, blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Person . . . blame. The key word refers to financial bonds. 	 	 	Bonds are guarnteed by the government so if they fail there is one person you can blame - the prime minister! 	 	On-Yomi: サイ   Kun-Yomi:"
pickling	"pickling 	 	漬   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1665   Strokes: 14   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: pickling, water, water droplets, water pistol, blame, grow up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Water . . . blame. 	 	 	When pickling you MUST use distilled water! When it doesn´t come out right, generally it is the water that is to blame. 	 	On-Yomi: シ   Kun-Yomi: つ.ける、つ.かる、-づ.け、-づけ  	Examples: 漬かる (つ.かる), 漬ける (つ.ける)"
surface	"surface 	 	表   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1666   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: surface, grow up, scarf 	 	Grow up . . . rags. This character represents the ""outside"" of a garment, just as the kanji for back (Frame 426) depicted the ""inside"" or lining. 	 	 	When I was GROWING UP, the SURFACE of my SCARF was always covered with snot from blowing my nose on it. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒョウ   Kun-Yomi: おもて、-おもて、あらわ.す、あらわ.れる、あら.わす  	Examples: 表す (あらわ.す), 表れる (あらわ.れる), 表 (おもて)"
bag	"bag 	 	俵   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1667   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: bag, person, surface, grow up, scarf 	 	Keep this kanji distinct from that for sack (Frame 1081). Its elements are: person . . . surface. 	 	 	Superficial people (ie those who are only concerned about the surface) are obsessed with expensive bags. 	 	On-Yomi: ヒョウ   Kun-Yomi: たわら  	Examples: 俵 (たわら)"
undefiled	"undefiled 	 	潔   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1668   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: undefiled, water, water droplets, water pistol, flick knife, grow up, sword, dagger, thread, spiderman 	 	Water . . . grow up . . . dagger . . . thread. Do not confuse with upright (Frame 58). 	 	 	To ensure she remained undefiled, a young girl growing up in a rough area always kept a dagger concealed under her threads, even when she went into the water. 	 	On-Yomi: ケツ   Kun-Yomi: いさぎよ.い  	Examples: 潔い (いさぎよ.い)"
pledge	"pledge 	 	契   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1669   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: pledge, flick knife, grow up, dagger, large, St. Bernard 	 	Grow up . . . dagger . . . St. Bernard dog. The connotation of this character should be kept distinct from that for vow (Frame 1214) and promise (Frame 1462). 	 	 	Imagine a totalitarian regime where, while growing up, you have to pledge allegiance to the flag at dagger-point and with St. Bernard guard dogs watching you. 	 	On-Yomi: ケイ   Kun-Yomi: ちぎ.る  	Examples: 契る (ちぎ.る)"
consume	"consume 	 	喫   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1670   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: consume, mouth, pledge, flick knife, grow up, dagger, large, St. Bernard 	 	Mouth . . . pledge. 	 	 	This means eat/drink/smoke. Maybe you make a pledge to stop gutsing/binging/puffing, but your own mouth is tempting you to put something in it. 	 	On-Yomi: キツ   Kun-Yomi:"
harm	"harm 	 	害   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1671   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: harm, mansion, house, grow up, mouth 	 	House . . . grow up . . . mouth. 	 	 	With kids growing up in your house, you have to keep them from harm of putting anything in their mouth, paint chips, bleach, knvies, etc. 	 	On-Yomi: ガイ   Kun-Yomi:"
control	"control 	 	轄   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1672   Strokes: 17   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: control, car, harm, mansion, house, grow up, mouth 	 	Car . . . harm. Hint: the image of an auto going ""out of control"" may help keep this key word distinct from others like it, such as manipulate (Frame 864). 	 	 	The roads are icy, and a whole bunch of cars have spun out of control! Luckily, it was just a couple of dents; nobody was harmed. 	 	On-Yomi: カツ   Kun-Yomi: くさび"
proportion	"proportion 	 	割   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1673   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: proportion, harm, mansion, house, grow up, mouth, sword, sabre, saber 	 	Harm . . . saber. 	 	 	[proportion; comparatively; divide; cut; separate; split] Hey, don´t take this out of proportion! I did you just a little harm, no need to come over here with a saber... 	 	On-Yomi: カツ   Kun-Yomi: わ.る、わり、わ.り、わ.れる、さ.く  	Examples: 割く (さ.く), 割る (わ.る), 割れる (わ.れる), 割 (わり)"
constitution	"constitution 	 	憲   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1674   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: constitution, mansion, house, grow up, eye, cross-eyed, net, heart 	 	The key word refers to the fundamental guiding principles of a government or other organization. Its elements: House . . . grow up . . . eyes . . . heart. 	 	 	The constitution is important. At least my parents thought so. In the house where I grew up, it was framed on the wall. Under the watchful (sideways) eye of my mother, we had to study it until we knew it by heart. 	 	On-Yomi: ケン   Kun-Yomi:"
life	"life 	 	生   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1675   Strokes: 5   —   Jouyou Grade: 1   JLPT: 5   	Constituents: life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 	 	A single drop added to the element for grow up gives us the character for life. 	  * As a primitive, we may think of a microscopic cell, that miraculous unit that grows up to become a living being. 	 	This is the first CELL of a human, the foundation of its entire LIFE, a small DROP that will GROW UP to form a complex organism. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ショウ   Kun-Yomi: い.きる、い.かす、い.ける、う.まれる、う.まれ、うまれ、う.む、お.う、は.える、は.やす、き、なま、なま-、な.る、な.す、む.す、-う  	Examples: 生活 (せいかつ), 発生 (はっせい), 先生 (せんせい), 生かす (い.かす), 生きる (い.きる), 生ける (い.ける), 生まれる (う.まれる), 生む (う.む), 生う (お.う), 生 (き), 生 (なま), 生える (は.える), 生やす (は.やす)"
star	"star 	 	星   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1676   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: star, sun, day, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 	 	Sun . . . cell. 	 	 	The sun is the nearest star to the only planet with life - Earth. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ショウ   Kun-Yomi: ほし、-ぼし  	Examples: 星座 (せいざ), 流星 (りゅうせい), 衛星 (えいせい), 星 (ほし)"
surname	"surname 	 	姓   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1678   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: surname, woman, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 	 	Woman . . . cell. 	 	 	When women marry, they adopt the surname of their husband, signifiying the start of a new life together. (adapted from gorgon). 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ショウ   Kun-Yomi:   	Examples: 姓名 (せいめい), 改姓 (かいせい), 同姓 (どうせい)"
sex	"sex 	 	性   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1679   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: sex, Freud, state of mind, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 	 	State of mind . . . cell. 	 	 	Sex is the only state of mind for many men through their whole life. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ、ショウ   Kun-Yomi: さが  	Examples: 性質 (せいしつ), 理性 (りせい), 男性 (だんせい)"
animal sacrifice	"animal sacrifice 	 	牲   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1680   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: animal sacrifice, cow, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 	 	Cow . . . cell. 	 	 	Animal sacrifice = taking the life of a cow. 	 	On-Yomi: セイ   Kun-Yomi:"
products	"products 	 	産   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1681   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: products, vase, stand up, cliff, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 	 	Vase . . . cliff . . . cell. 	 	 	If you were to stand up all the products you have accumulated over the course of your entire life on top of one another, the result would probably be as tall as a cliff. 	 	On-Yomi: サン   Kun-Yomi: う.む、う.まれる、うぶ-、む.す  	Examples: 産まれる (う.まれる), 産む (う.む), 産 (うぶ)"
hump	"hump 	 	隆   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1682   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: hump, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, walking legs, life, This is Your Life, cell, drop, grow up 	 	This character, used for everything from little humps of hills to camel humps, easily suggests the hunch on the pig's back and hind parts where the best cuts of meat are to be found (and hence the English expression for luxury, ""living high off the hog."") The elements we have to work with are: pinnacle . . . walking legs . . . cell. 	 	 	You are struggling to the top across the humps, but you suddenly see the pinnacle and you feel new life in your walking legs. 	 	On-Yomi: リュウ   Kun-Yomi:"
summit	"summit 	 	峰   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1683   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: summit, mountain, Segway, Macbeth, walking legs, bushes 	 	Mountain . . . walking legs . . . bushes. 	 	 	Walking legs over ""bushes"" needs to have a primitive meaning of its own. It appears in several kanji, such as 縫 sew (#1563), 逢 tryst (#2417), 蜂 bee (#2687), and 鋒 sword´s point (#2768), and it is clumsy to work bushes and walking legs into every story. ""Pointy"" works fairly well: the walking legs are stuck on top of the pointy part of the bush; and for this character: a summit is the pointy end of a mountain. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: みね、ね  	Examples: 峰 (みね)"
sew	"sew 	 	縫   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1685   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: sew, thread, spiderman, tryst, Segway, Macbeth, walking legs, bushes, road 	 	Thread . . . walking legs . . . bushes . . . road. 	 	 	Pointy primitive; with a pointy needle you sew a road (-------) of threads. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi: ぬ.う  	Examples: 縫う (ぬ.う)"
worship	"worship 	 	拝   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1686   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: worship, finger, fingers, one, ceiling, bushes 	 	Fingers . . . bush . . . suspended from the ceiling. 	 	 	I put my fingers together in worship of the bush that hangs from the ceiling -- that wonderful mistletoe which has gotten me kissed by many a girl. 	 	On-Yomi: ハイ   Kun-Yomi: おが.む、おろが.む  	Examples: 拝む (おが.む)"
longevity	"longevity 	 	寿   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1687   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT:    	Constituents: longevity, bushes, glue 	 	Bushes . . . glue. 	 	 	In an attempt to increase a bush's longevity, an incompitent gardener glues all the leaves back on that have fallen off. Maybe he should have tried watering it instead. 	 	On-Yomi: ジュ、ス、シュウ   Kun-Yomi: ことぶき、ことぶ.く、ことほ.ぐ  	Examples: 寿 (ことぶき)"
casting	"casting 	 	鋳   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1688   Strokes: 15   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: casting, metal, gold, longevity, bushes, glue 	 	Metal . . . longevity. As you probably guessed from the elements, the key word refers to the casting of metals. 	 	 	We take a casting because metal will have much greater longevity than the original. 	 	On-Yomi: チュウ、イ、シュ、シュウ   Kun-Yomi: い.る  	Examples: 鋳る (い.る)"
enroll	"enroll 	 	籍   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1689   Strokes: 20   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: enroll, bamboo, christmas tree, wood, once upon a time, storyteller 	 	Bamboo . . . Christmas tree . . . once upon a time. 	 	 	Japanese father enrolls his student in a well-rounded school: they teach eastern traditions (the way of the bamboo), western traditions (like Christmas trees), and also teach literature (once upon a time). 	 	On-Yomi: セキ   Kun-Yomi:"
springtime	"springtime 	 	春   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1690   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: springtime, bonsai, sun, day 	 	Bonsai . . . sun. 	 	 	In the springtime bonsai get plenty of sun. 	 	On-Yomi: シュン   Kun-Yomi: はる  	Examples: 春 (はる)"
camellia	"camellia 	 	椿   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1691   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: camellia, tree, wood, springtime, bonsai, sun, day 	 	Tree . . . springtime. 	 	 	The tree of spring. Fact: Camellia are highly valued in Japan and elsewhere for their very early flowering, often among the first flowers to appear in the late winter [early spring?]. 	 	On-Yomi: チン、チュン   Kun-Yomi: つばき"
peaceful	"peaceful 	 	泰   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1692   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: peaceful, bonsai, grains of rice 	 	Bonsai . . . rice grains. 	 	 	If you look into Japanese gardens they seem so peaceful - with their small bonsais and the white stones looking like rice grains. 	 	On-Yomi: タイ   Kun-Yomi:"
play music	"play music 	 	奏   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1693   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: play music, bonsai, heavens 	 	Bonsai . . . heavens. 	 	 	When you play music to them, your bonsai will grow like they are in heaven. 	 	On-Yomi: ソウ   Kun-Yomi: かな.でる  	Examples: 奏でる (かな.でる)"
reality	"reality 	 	実   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1694   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: reality, house, bonsai 	 	House . . . bonsai. 	 	 	Bonsais are grown in a house, away from the harsh reality of the real world where they wouldn´t survive. 	 	On-Yomi: ジツ、シツ   Kun-Yomi: み、みの.る、まこと、まことに、みの、みち.る  	Examples: 実 (み), 実る (みの.る)"
dedicate	"dedicate 	 	奉   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1695   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: observance, dedicate, bonsai, cornstalk 	 	Bonsai . . . cornstalk. Use a ritualistic, religious meaning. 	 	 	To join the temple, you have to dedicate yourself to raising bonsai for enlightenment, and cornstalks for sustenance. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ、ブ   Kun-Yomi: たてまつ.る、まつ.る、ほう.ずる  	Examples: 奉納 (ほうのう), 奉仕 (ほうし), 信奉 (しんぽう), 奉る (たてまつ.る)"
stipend	"stipend 	 	俸   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1696   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: stipend, person, observance, dedicate, bonsai, cornstalk 	 	Person . . . dedicate. 	 	 	The stipend is given to the student-PERSON who has come to Japan DEDICATED to study. 	 	On-Yomi: ホウ   Kun-Yomi:"
rod	"rod 	 	棒   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1697   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: rod, tree, wood, observance, dedicate, bonsai, cornstalk 	 	Tree . . . dedicate. 	 	 	This wooden rod has one very simple dedication engraved on it: ""Spare the rod, spoil the child..."". 	 	On-Yomi: ボウ   Kun-Yomi:"
discreet	"discreet 	 	謹   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1698   Strokes: 17   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: discreet, say, words, keitai, mouth, cabbage, flowers, mouth, grow up 	 	Words . . . cabbage. 	 	 	Muttering words of gratitude for a wonderful meal, I discreetly slipped my cabbage under the table for the dog. 	 	On-Yomi: キン   Kun-Yomi: つつし.む  	Examples: 謹む (つつし.む)"
diligence	"diligence 	 	勤   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1700   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: diligence, cabbage, flowers, mouth, grow up, power, muscle, arnold 	 	Cabbage . . . muscle. 	 	 	With enough diligence, Koreans can turn ordinary cabbage into powerful kimchi. 	 	On-Yomi: キン、ゴン   Kun-Yomi: つと.める、-づと.め、つと.まる、いそ.しむ  	Examples: 勤務 (きんむ), 勤勉 (きんべん), 出勤 (しゅっきん), 勤まる (つと.まる), 勤める (つと.める)"
Sino-	"Sino- 	 	漢   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1701   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: sino, water, water droplets, water pistol, scarecrow, flowers, mouth, husband 	 	Water . . . scarecrow. The key word has come to refer to things Chinese in general, including the kanji themselves (for which this character is used). 	 	 	Sino- (Chinese) people had to put a lot of sweat/water into learning the kanji. For right-hand kanji primitive - The dumb Western husband of a Japanese woman buys her flowers to apologise, after he opened his big mouth and said ""kanji are a stupid writing system"".. 	 	On-Yomi: カン   Kun-Yomi:"
sigh	"sigh 	 	嘆   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1702   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: sigh, mouth, scarecrow, flowers, mouth, husband 	 	Mouth . . . scarecrow. 	 	 	A sigh escapes the mouth of the scarecrow, who laments: ""...if I only had a brain, I could learn kanji"". 	 	On-Yomi: タン   Kun-Yomi: なげ.く、なげ.かわしい  	Examples: 嘆かわしい (なげ.かわしい), 嘆く (なげ.く)"
difficult	"difficult 	 	難   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1703   Strokes: 18   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: difficult, scarecrow, flowers, mouth, husband, turkey 	 	Scarecrow . . . turkey. 	 	 	Learning Kanji is difficult for Turkeys. 	 	On-Yomi: ナン   Kun-Yomi: かた.い、-がた.い、むずか.しい、むづか.しい、むつか.しい、-にく.い  	Examples: 難い (かた.い), 難しい (むずか.しい)"
splendor	"splendor 	 	華   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1704   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: splendor, flowers, silage, ten, needle 	 	Flower . . . silage . . . needle. 	 	 	The Queen of England taking a walk round a village: ´Excuse me, I couldn´t help noticing the splendour of the flowers in your garden. Simply splendid. Ten out of ten.´ The villager gruffly replies: ´No it ´aint. It´s all muck. An´ I´m gonna cut it all down and sell it to the farmer for silage.´. 	 	On-Yomi: カ、ケ   Kun-Yomi: はな  	Examples: 華美 (かび), 繁華 (はんか), 栄華 (えいが), 華 (はな)"
droop	"droop 	 	垂   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1705   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 6   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: droop, drop, silage, walking cane, stick, one, floor 	 	A drop of . . . silage . . . walking stick . . . floor. The character is written in the order of its elements. 	 	 	The thousand head of cattle let their heads droop as they devour the silage (animal fodder) that is lying on the floor around them. 	 	On-Yomi: スイ   Kun-Yomi: た.れる、た.らす、た.れ、-た.れ、なんなんと.す  	Examples: 垂らす (た.らす), 垂れる (た.れる)"
drowsy	"drowsy 	 	睡   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1707   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: drowsy, eye, droop, drop, silage, walking cane, stick, one, floor 	 	Eyes . . . droop. 	 	 	Our eyes droop when we are drowsy. 	 	On-Yomi: スイ   Kun-Yomi:"
spindle	"spindle 	 	錘   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1708   Strokes: 16   —   Jouyou Grade: Names   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: spindle, metal, gold, droop, drop, silage, walking cane, stick, one, floor 	 	Metal . . . droop. 	 	 	Wasn´t it a cursed spindle that Sleeping Beauty pricked her finger on? Therefore the spindle was the metal that caused her to droop and eventually sleep for 100 years. 	 	On-Yomi: スイ   Kun-Yomi: つむ、おもり  	Examples: 錘 (つむ)"
ride	"ride 	 	乗   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1709   Strokes: 9   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: ride, wheat, cereal, silage 	 	The simplest way to remember this character is to find the sprig of wheat in it, hidden because it doubles up with one stroke of silage. 	 	 	It´s a hay ride! You sit on piles of silage and everyone likes to imitate old-time farmers with a piece of wheat sticking out of their mouths. 	 	On-Yomi: ジョウ、ショウ   Kun-Yomi: の.る、-の.り、の.せる  	Examples: 乗せる (の.せる), 乗る (の.る)"
surplus	"surplus 	 	剰   	   	Lesson: 40   Frame: 1710   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: surplus, ride, wheat, cereal, silage, sword, sabre, saber 	 	Ride . . . saber. 	 	 	If you go for a ride and find a saber beside you, perhaps you got into an Army surplus jeep. 	 	On-Yomi: ジョウ   Kun-Yomi: あまつさえ、あま.り、あま.る"
now	"now 	 	今   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1711   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 5   	Constituents: now, meeting, umbrella, one, 7 	 	The final stroke of this kanji is a rare shape, which we have not met before and will only meet in this character and others that include it as a primitive. We are more accustomed to seeing it straightened out as part of other shapes - for instance, as the second stroke of mouth. If you need any help at all with this character, you may picture it as two hands of a clock pointing to what time it is now. The element above it, meeting, should easily relate to that image. 	  * We shall use clock as the primitive meaning of this character, in line with the above explanation. 	 	My MEETING is at 7- but that´s NOW! 	 	On-Yomi: コン、キン   Kun-Yomi: いま  	Examples: 今後 (こんご), 今日 (きょう), 今朝 (けさ), 今年 (こんねん), 昨今 (さっこん), 今 (いま)"
include	"include 	 	含   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1712   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: include, now, clock, mouth 	 	Clock . . . mouth. 	 	 	This clock includes a mouth that will tell you what the time is now. Hearing impaired people have this kind of watches... now imagine them as a big mouth under the clock. 	 	On-Yomi: ガン   Kun-Yomi: ふく.む、ふく.める  	Examples: 含む (ふく.む), 含める (ふく.める)"
versify	"versify 	 	吟   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1714   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: versify, mouth, now, clock 	 	As we have already learned characters for poem (Frame 370), chant (Frame 21), and song (Frame 508), it is important to protect this key word with an image all its own. Its elements are the same as those above; only the position has changed: mouth . . . clock. 	 	 	Versify this kanji as follows: Hickery dickery dock, the mouth ran by the clock. 	 	On-Yomi: ギン   Kun-Yomi:"
wish	"wish 	 	念   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1715   Strokes: 8   —   Jouyou Grade: 4   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: wish, now, clock, heart 	 	Clock . . . heart. 	 	 	Someone wishing from the bottom of their heart that the clock would stop. A mid-life crisis perhaps. 	 	On-Yomi: ネン   Kun-Yomi:"
harp	"harp 	 	琴   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1717   Strokes: 12   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: harp, king, jewel, ball, now, clock, king2, jewel2, ball2 	 	A pair of jewels . . . clock. 	 	 	Two kings were fighting over a beautiful koto (harp). So they had a clock built into it that would measure how long each one played it. That way they could be sure none played it more than othe other. 	 	On-Yomi: キン   Kun-Yomi: こと  	Examples: 琴 (こと)"
shade	"shade 	 	陰   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1718   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: shade, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, now, clock, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall 	 	Just as the sunshine (Frame 1397) represents the masculine principle in nature (Yang), the shade stands for the feminine principle (Yin). Its elements are: pinnacle . . . clock . . . rising cloud. 	 	 	There are three types of shade: 1. natural (a high pinnacle), 2. man-made buildings (a clock tower), 3. meteorological (a cloud). 	 	On-Yomi: イン   Kun-Yomi: かげ、かげ.る  	Examples: 陰 (かげ), 陰る (かげ.る)"
beforehand	"beforehand 	 	予   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1719   Strokes: 4   —   Jouyou Grade: 3   JLPT: 3   	Constituents: beforehand, halberd with stroke missing 	 	Think of this character as identical to the halberd (Frame 1311) except that the final stroke has been omitted. Return to that character and devise some image to take this difference into account. 	 	 	Beforehand, this was a halberd but I cut it short so it could be for hand to hand combat. 	 	On-Yomi: ヨ、シャ   Kun-Yomi: あらかじ.め"
preface	"preface 	 	序   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1720   Strokes: 7   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: preface, cave, beforehand 	 	Cave . . . beforehand. 	 	 	The preface to all human history was written beforehand in caves. 	 	On-Yomi: ジョ   Kun-Yomi: つい.で、ついで"
deposit	"deposit 	 	預   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1721   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: 5   JLPT: 2   	Constituents: deposit, beforehand, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight 	 	Beforehand . . . head. 	 	 	Depositing money into your savings account is something you do beforehand if you use your head. If you´re in Japan your passbook says 預金機（よきんき）when you make a deposit. 	 	On-Yomi: ヨ   Kun-Yomi: あず.ける、あず.かる  	Examples: 預かる (あず.かる), 預ける (あず.ける)"
plains	"plains 	 	野   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1722   Strokes: 11   —   Jouyou Grade: 2   JLPT: 4   	Constituents: plains, computer, beforehand 	 	This character refers to rustic life and rustic fields primarily, and from there gets derived meanings. Its elements: computer. . beforehand. 	 	 	These days we all work in front of computers. Beforehand we all worked out in the fields, in the plains. 	 	On-Yomi: ヤ、ショ   Kun-Yomi: の、の-  	Examples: 野 (の)"
concurrently	"concurrently 	 	兼   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1723   Strokes: 10   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: concurrently, animal horns, rake, stick, stick2 	 	At the top we have the animal horns and the single horizontal stroke to give them something to hang onto. Below that, we see one rake with two handles. Finally, we see a pair of strokes splitting away from each of the handles, indicating that they are both splitting under the pressure. The composite picture is of someone holding down two jobs concurrently, using the same kit of tools to move in two different directions and ending up in a mess. Take the time to find this sense in the kanji and it will be easy to remember, despite initial appearances. 	 	 	Our ninja hero, disguised as a gardener with a rake, is suddenly attacked from both left and right concurrently by bulls with animal horns. Our hero lets out a blood-curdling scream and tears his rake handle vertically in half, so he now has two wooden staffs (split rake handle) to fight with. He grips each staff (left side and right side) and rams it into the horns of the charging bulls. The force of each charging bull causes the tips of each staff to split again (split bottom of each rake handle). 	 	On-Yomi: ケン   Kun-Yomi: か.ねる、-か.ねる  	Examples: 兼ねる (か.ねる)"
dislike	"dislike 	 	嫌   	   	Lesson: 41   Frame: 1724   Strokes: 13   —   Jouyou Grade: JH   JLPT: 1   	Constituents: dislike, woman, concurrently, animal horns, rake 	 	Woman . . . concurrently. 	 	 	Naturally, if you´re dating more than one woman concurrently, they will certainly dislike each other! 	 	On-Yomi: ケン、ゲン   Kun-Yomi: きら.う、きら.い、いや  	Examples: 嫌悪 (けんお), 嫌疑 (けんぎ), 嫌 (いや), 嫌う (きら.う)"
